provisions please refer to the codealert amendment list  citation formeffective date a pursuant to title 31 of the colorado revised statutes there is hereby adopted the code of ordinances entitled the city of caon city colorado 198 compiled revised and codified for the city of caon city by book publishing company of seattle washington by authority of the city council of the city and containing a compilation revision and codification of the permanent and general ordinances of the city hereinafter referred to as code or primary code of which code not less than three copies have been and are now filed in and incorporated into the ordinance codified in this chapter as if set out at length herein as provided by of of title 31 colorado revised statutes 198 as amended b the code adopted may be cited as the city of caon city colorado 198 or by the short title caon city municipal when a change or changes have been prepared and inserted in the code as provided herein the words as amended may be added to the above citation or title when referring to the code as amended c the code adopted hereby shall go into effect on  at  am   prior code    inclusion of city charter the charter of the city of caon city colorado is included in the code of the ordinances hereby adopted for convenience   prior code    reference applies to all amendments whenever a reference is made to this the caon city municipal or to any portion thereof the reference shall apply to all amendments corrections and additions made before as of or after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter   prior code    repeal of prior ordinances all ordinances and parts of ordinances of a primary and general nature passed prior to  and in effect at the time the the city of caon city colorado 198 is adopted but not included in said code are repealed as of the time when the code goes into effect ordinances passed on or after  shall not be repealed or amended by the adoption of the code and the ordinance codified in this chapter   prior code    matters not affected by repeal the repeal of ordinances and parts of ordinances of a permanent and general nature by not affect any offense committed or act done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract right or obligation established prior to the time when such ordinances and parts of ordinances are repealed   prior code    ordinances saved from repeal the repeal of ordinances of a general and permanent nature by this chapter shall not repeal any ordinance or part thereof saved from repeal specifically by the caon city municipal   nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance a promising guaranteeing or authorizing the payment of money by or for the city  b authorizing or relating to specific issuances of bonds or other evidences of indebtedness  c granting a franchise  d establishing the compensation of city officers or employees  e levying taxes making appropriations or adopting a budget  f creating specific local improvement districts  g making special assessments for local improvements  h vacating accepting establishing locating relocating or opening any street or public way  i affecting the corporate limits of the city  j which is of a special or temporary nature  k dedicating or accepting any plat or subdivision  l setting rates for any services or utilities provided by the city  m creating contractual obligation on the part of the city   prior code    catchlines headings and titles catchlines headings and titles of sections and other subdivisions in the code adopted by this chapter or in changes made in the code are inserted for the convenience of users of the code and shall have no legal effect notes indicating sources of sections giving other information or referring to the statutes or to other parts of the code or to the city charter are inserted in the code and may be inserted in changes to the code for the convenience of persons using the code and shall have no legal effect   prior code    penalty for altering or tampering with code any person firm or corporation who shall alter change or amend the the ordinances adopted by this chapter except in the manner prescribed by this chapter or who shall alter or tamper with the any manner so as to cause the ordinances of the city to be misrepresented thereby shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided by this   prior code    severability of ordinance provisions each section of this chapter is an independent section and the holding of any section or part thereof to be unconstitutional void or ineffective for any cause shall not be deemed to affect the validity or constitutionality of any other section or part thereof   prior code    severability of code provisions if any sections section or subsection or provision of this ordinances or the application thereof to any person or circumstances is declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by any competent court such invalidity shall not affect the other sections section subsection or provision or application   prior code   this topic has been modified view the section for details  secondary codes adopted by administrator b the city clerk shall cause to be prepared and published revised sheets of every looseleaf page in need of revision by reason of amendment addition or repeal when directed by the city city of caon city   prior code   general provisions  misdemeanor and offense defined the words misdemeanor and offense wherever they occur in the city ordinances shall be construed to mean and shall severally stand in lieu of a violation of ordinance and shall not have the meaning prescribed by colorado revised statutes 1973   heretofore and  hereafter defined whenever the term heretofore occurs in any ordinance of the city it shall be construed to mean any time previous to the time when such ordinance takes effect  and whenever the term hereafter occurs it shall be construed to mean any time after such ordinance takes effect   plural and singular number whenever in any ordinance of this city words importing the plural number are used in describing or referring to any object matter parties or persons any single object matter party or person shall be deemed to be included although distributive words to that effect may not be used   number and gender when any subject matter party or person is described or referred to in any ordinance by words importing the singular number or the masculine gender several things matters and persons and females as well as males and firms and bodies corporate as well as individuals shall be deemed to be included   exceptions to  the rules prescribed in shall apply in all cases unless it be otherwise expressly provided in any ordinance or unless there is something in the subject or context repugnant to such construction   phrases regarding the city or city council the phrases the city and this city whenever such occur in city ordinances shall be construed to mean the city of caon city in the state of colorado  and the phrases the council and the city council when thus occurring shall be construed to mean the city council of the city unless the context clearly indicates another meaning   law state law and statutes defined whenever the words law state law statutes or other words are used in the ordinances of the city referring to the statutes of the state of colorado they shall have the meaning prescribed by the charter   officers and employees the mayor councilmembers city administrator city attorney and municipal judge are declared to be officers of the city and all other persons serving the city in any capacity whatsoever are declared to be employees in accordance with of the charter   severability if a court of competent jurisdiction should hold one or more sections or a part of a section of this of an ordinance passed hereafter invalid such holding shall not affect the remainder of the code or ordinance nor the context in which such section sections or part of a section so held invalid may appear except to the extent that an entire section or part of a section may be inseparably connected in meaning and effect with the section sections or part of a section so held invalid  city seal  city seal designateddescription a seal the impression of which is as follows in the center the words seal incorporated  and around the outer edge the words the city of caon city colorado shall be and is declared to be the seal of the city of caon city  voting precincts and elections  district map council member districts and voting precincts a district map adopted effective  the official city council district map shall be that certain city council district boundary map formally approved by majority of council at its  regular meeting the original of which shall be kept in the office of the city clerk b posting of official map the city clerk is hereby authorized to prepare post andor otherwise display andor distribute true and correct copies of the official map and of each of the four 4 districts designated thereon c general location of districts for purposes of general information 1 district one shall include land within the incorporated limits of the city that is generally lying within the northwest section of the city as more specifically designated on the official map 2 district two shall include land within the incorporated limits of the city that is generally lying within the southwest section of the city including the dawson ranch area as more specifically designated on the official map 3 district three shall include land within the incorporated limits of the city that is generally lying within the northcentral section of the city as more specifically designated on the official map 4 district four shall include land within the incorporated limits of the city that is generally lying within the southcentral section of the city and in the four mile ranch area as more specifically designated on the official map d voting precincts with respect to elections where it is deemed necessary to establish voting precincts the locations of such voting precincts shall be established in advance of the election by the duly designated election official for such election   polling places polling places for regular and special municipal elections shall be determined and designated by a the fremont county clerk or such other person authorized to designate polling places under the uniform election as amended articles 1 to 13 of title 1 crs in all cases where the city is participating in a coordinated election conducted by the fremont county clerk  or b the city clerk pursuant to the colorado municipal election of title 31 crs as amended or other applicable law with respect to all other municipal elections   council member districts a for purposes of defining and identifying the four 4 districts within which the four 4 council members who are subject to district residency requirements must reside the following shall apply and supersede any conflicting provision of the charter and prior ordinances of the city 1 the boundaries of district one shall coincide with the boundaries of district one as shown on the official map identified in shall include all of the land within said boundaries and any land immediately adjacent to the land in district one that is annexed into the city after  2 the boundaries of district two shall coincide with the boundaries of district two as shown on the official map identified in shall include all of the land within said boundaries and any land immediately adjacent to the land in district two that is annexed into the city after  3 the boundaries of district three shall coincide with the boundaries of district three as shown on the official map identified in shall include all of the land within said boundaries and any land immediately adjacent to the land in district three that is annexed into the city after  4 the boundaries of district four shall coincide with the boundaries of district four as shown on the official map identified in shall include all of the land within said boundaries and any land immediately adjacent to the land in district four that is annexed into the city after  b the foregoing designations are authorized and mandated by of of of the charter of caon city except as is otherwise provided in the charter one member of city council who is not a council member atlarge must reside in each district designated in of this section    municipal court  establishment there shall be a municipal court presided over by a municipal judge as provided by of to 4 inclusive of of the city charter   municipal judgequalifications the municipal judge in addition to the qualification prescribed by the city charter shall have been admitted to and currently licensed in the practice of law in colorado   jurisdiction of the court the municipal court shall have exclusive original jurisdiction to hear try and determine all cases arising under the city charter and the ordinances of the city for the violation and enforcement thereof and there shall be no change of venue therefrom   municipal courtauthority to issue restraining orders a the municipal court is authorized to issue temporary and permanent civil restraining orders as provided for in of of title 13 crs provided that such authority shall be limited to restraining orders authorized in 4b crs and further provided that the only business entity which shall be authorized to seek and receive the issuance of a restraining order under this subsection will be the city of caon city for the protection of one or more city employees b for purposes of this section city employee means and includes all elected and appointed city officers and all full and parttime city employees and all regular and alternate members of the citys official boards and commissions c the municipal court shall utilize the forms and process described in of title 13 crs with respect to any petition motion or other request for the issuance of any temporary or permanent restraining order that it is authorized to issue and enforce under the limited authority granted in of this section   municipal courtauthority to order restitution a discretionary authority is expressly granted to the judges of the municipal court to award as restitution to any victim of any civil infraction or criminal violation of this an amount equal to the actual damages suffered by said victim or to order a person found or pleading guilty to any such violation to pay such restitution as ordered by the municipal court b discretionary authority is expressly granted to the municipal court to order restitution for any and all costs incurred by public safety andor emergency response agencies of the city or other governmental or quasigovernmental entities in connection with the initial response to and all subsequent followup investigation of violations of this when granted restitution shall be determined by the submission of a bill of costs by said victim or agency to the municipal court on a form approved by the municipal court but the municipal court shall be limited to awarding as such restitution only actual costs incurred by said victim that can be determined with a reasonable amount of certainty and whenever it is determined by the court that the payment of restitution is fair and reasonable the specific amount of restitution shall be determined within the ninety 90 days immediately following the order of conviction or imposition of deferred judgment or deferred sentence unless good cause is shown for extending the time period by which the restitution amount shall be determined d any restitution ordered by the municipal court shall be in addition to any fine or imprisonment authorized by this shall be applicable to any situation in which deferred judgment or deferred sentence is accepted andor imposed by the municipal court   rules of procedure the municipal court rules of procedure promulgated by the supreme court of the state from time to time shall govern the procedures in the municipal court   sentence may include useful communitypublic service a a defendant convicted of a misdemeanor petty offense or infraction in the municipal court may be sentenced to perform useful communitypublic service such useful communitypublic service may be as a condition of or in addition to any other sentence provided by this for the purposes of this section useful communitypublic service means any work which is beneficial to the public any public entity or any bona fide nonprofit private or public organization which work involves a minimum of direct supervision or other public cost and which work would not with the exercise of reasonable care endanger the health or safety of the person required to work in addition the court may at its discretion order that a defendant participate in a specific useful communitypublic service program c in addition to other court costs imposed by the court any defendant sentenced to useful communitypublic service shall pay court costs of five dollars $500 for costs incurred by the city in obtaining insurance coverage   contempt of court the municipal judge shall have full power and authority to punish for contempt of his or her court  provided however that no person shall be punished for contempt by imprisonment unless the imposition of such punishment is preceded by a hearing at which such person may be represented by competent legal counsel and further provided that no imprisonment for contempt shall exceed five 5 days no fine for contempt shall exceed the maximum fine provided for in this   prior code    assessment of costs costs in an amount deemed appropriate by the municipal judge but not in excess of three hundred dollars $30000 may be assessed by the municipal judge against any defendant who upon conviction is found guilty of a violation of any ordinance of the city all costs incurred by the city with respect to the issuance of any warrant issued by the municipal court on account of the failure of any defendant or of any person previously convicted of an ordinance violation in municipal court to appear before the municipal court at a specified date and time for proceedings involving said defendant or convicted person shall be assessable by the municipal court against such defendant or convicted person as costs   records of trial proceedings the municipal court shall keep a verbatim record of the proceedings and evidence at trials by either electric devices or stenographic means and shall in all respects be a qualified municipal court of record as such court is defined by the statutes of the state   surcharge a a surcharge equal to the greater of ten dollars $1000 or ten percent 10% of the fine imposed for violation of all municipal ordinances except parking violations is levied on each municipal court action resulting in a conviction or in a deferred judgment and sentence which municipal ordinance violation is charged pursuant to city of caon city ordinances all calculated surcharge amounts resulting in dollars and cents shall be rounded down to the nearest whole dollar if a portion of the fine is suspended a proportionate amount of this surcharge levied shall also be suspended but in no event shall the surcharge be reduced to an amount less than ten dollars $1000 if the suspension of the fine is thereafter revoked the surcharge shall be reimposed on the total amount of the fine imposed such surcharges shall be paid to the clerk of the court by the defendant b the moneys shall be deposited in the general fund of the city and are intended to be allocated for the following purposes including but not limited to purchase of equipment training programs and additional personnel for a victims assistance program and to domestic violence programs within the community  trials  jury trial conditions a cases in the municipal court shall be tried by the court unless the defendant is entitled to a jury trail under the constitution and general laws of the state the charter of the city or the ordinances of the city and the defendant shall request a jury trial in writing b a jury shall consist of three jurors unless the defendant demands a jury comprised of a larger number of jurors but in no event shall a jury be comprised of more than six in number   terms of court for the purpose of selecting jurors for the municipal court of the city the terms of the court shall be held in each and every year commencing on the second monday of september and march   selection of jurors a the city clerk fortyfive days or more before the commencement of a term of the court shall select not less than fifty inhabitants of the city having the qualifications as prescribed by the statutes of the state for jurors of its district courts and who are not exempted by said statutes b the city clerk shall obtain a list of the names prescribed by this section from the city voter registration list supplemented from other lists which may be available such as water customers utility customers city directories telephone directories driver license registration and property taxpayers c the city clerk shall upon the compilation of the list of names certify it to the clerk of the municipal court   ballot boxrequired description the clerk of the municipal court shall keep a box of suitable dimensions having two compartments each of which shall be closed with a lid or cover and fastened with lock and key an opening shall be made in each of said lids not exceeding two inches in length and onefourth inch in width which shall be for the reception of ballots the box shall remain in the possession of the court clerk and shall not be opened except at the time and in the manner specified in the keys to the same shall be kept by the city administrator   ballot boxuse to select jurors the clerk of the municipal court shall write the names certified to him on ballots in one compartment of the box at least thirty days prior to the term of the court and afterwards as often as the court shall order the clerk of the municipal court shall call to his assistance the city administrator of the city and in the presence of the city administrator draw by chance from the compartment of the box in which names have been placed a sufficient number of jurors for the next term of the municipal court when so drawn the ballots shall be placed in the other compartment of the box   exemption from jury service at the end of each term of court the court clerk shall certify to the city clerk the names of all persons who have served on any regular panel of jurors at the preceding term and the persons so certified shall not be again returned as jurors during a period of one year thereafter the court clerk shall also destroy all ballots remaining in the box and for the succeeding term of court the names of persons shall be certified by the city clerk and the jurors be drawn in the manner provided in this chapter the names of competent persons may be successively returned by the city clerk until they have been drawn as jurors and until they have performed service as such when they shall be omitted for at least one year   summoning jurors a if a jury is ordered to be drawn the clerk thereafter shall cause each person drawn for jury service to be served with a summons either personally or by registered or certified mail return receipt requested addressed to him at his usual residence business or post office address requiring him to report for jury service at a specified time and place b whenever there is an unanticipated shortage of available jurors drawn from a qualified jury list the court may require the court clerk to summon a sufficient number of jurors from bystanders but either party may show cause why bystanders should not be used in which case additional jurors may be selected at random by the clerk from the qualified jury list or in any other manner prescribed by the court   excusal from jury serviceconditions a person who is not disqualified for jury service may be excused from jury service by the court only upon a showing of undue hardship extreme inconvenience or public necessity for a period the court deems necessary at the conclusion of which the person shall reappear for jury service in accordance with the courts direction   peremptory challenge and discharge if any juror summoned shall be interested in the event of the case or kin to a defendant or shall have expressed this opinion on the matter about to be tried or shall for any cause to be judged by the municipal judge be considered as a partial or improper juror the municipal judge shall discharge such juror in all cases arising under the charter or ordinances of the city wherein a jury trial is had each party shall be entitled to three 3 peremptory challenges   verdict and sentencing upon the jury returning a verdict of guilty the municipal judge shall record the same and shall proceed to fix or determine the punishment or penalty and to render judgment upon such verdict for the punishment or penalty so determined by him or her  but if the jury returns a verdict of not guilty the municipal judge shall record the same and shall discharge the defendant or defendants   plea of guiltyhearing by court if any person accused of violating any of the provisions of the charter or ordinances of the city having a right of trial by jury for such alleged violation thereof confesses him or herself guilty the municipal court without a jury shall hear the evidence relating to such violation and fix and determine the punishment or penalty and shall enter judgment and issue execution thereon   jurors fees jurors shall receive for attending municipal court three dollars $300 per day to be paid out of the general fund of the city  general penalty  penalty for code violations a maximum general penalty whenever in any provision in the charter of caon city or in this or in any secondary code adopted by the city or in any ordinance of the city that is not codified or in any order rule or regulation promulgated under the provisions of this any act is prohibited made or declared to be unlawful an offense a nuisance or a misdemeanor any person who shall be convicted of the violation of any such provision shall be punished by a fine of not more than two thousand six hundred fifty dollars $265000 unless some other penalty is specifically provided therefor in such provision a separate offense may be charged and a separate fine may be imposed upon conviction for each calendar day when any such violation occurs or continues to occur b annual increases in maximum fine amount the limitation on municipal court fines set forth in of this section shall be adjusted for inflation on  and on january 1 of each year thereafter as used in this inflation means the annual percentage change in the united states department of labor bureau of labor statistics consumer price index for denverboulder all items all urban consumers or its successor index c penalty for proceeding without a required valid license permit or certificate any person who pursues any business trade or calling or does any act for which a license permit or certificate is required without holding or having a valid license permit or certificate is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine that is not more than the maximum fine permitted under of this section d personall inclusive definition as used in this person shall mean and include a natural person association corporation partnership limited liability company and any other legal entity capable of owning using or occupying real property or of transacting business within the city unless the context clearly indicates otherwise    title 2 administration and personnel mayor and council city administrator city clerk finance department fire authority law department city engineer water department planning commission appeals of administrative decisions employees pensions city parkscity cemetery protection of paleontological resources librarymuseum advisory board administrative departments prohibited gifts to city officials royal gorge regional tourism council mayor and council  councilexecutive and administrative powers all executive and administrative powers and duties of the city government except those which have been delegated to the city administrator pursuant to the charter are vested in the council  provided also that all powers and duties which have been delegated to the city administrator shall also be vested in the council during a vacancy in the office of city administrator   reservation of powers a all legislative powers of the council approval of all bills indebtedness and claims against the city the granting or approval of all licenses permits contracts agreements obligations and instruments on behalf of the city and all powers not included in or incidental to the powers and authority specifically set forth in are reserved to the council b there are also excepted and reserved to the mayor and other city officers all of the executive and administrative powers authority and duties granted such officers by the city charter or incidental thereto and which may not be delegated by the council to the city administrator according to the city charter   compensation a the compensation payable by the city to the mayor shall be the annual sum of nine thousand dollars $900000 payable in installments on and according to the citys schedule of regular pay days b the compensation payable by the city to all other members of city council shall be the annual sum of six thousand dollars $600000 payable in installments on and according to the citys schedule of regular pay days       ceremonial functionsauthority of the mayor the mayor shall have the power and authority to perform ceremonial functions that are in keeping with the proper conduct of the affairs of the city such powers shall include the power to solemnize marriages and to complete and sign marriage certificate forms in accordance with the requirements of applicable colorado statutes including but not necessarily limited to crs   council meetingstimeplacespecial meetings a except as provided in subsection b of this section the city council shall hold regular meetings on the first and third monday of each month commencing at the hour of six pm b rescheduling of regular meetings 1 whenever the date of a regular meeting shall fall on the date for the national celebration of martin luther king jr day such meeting shall not be held on monday but shall be held on the following tuesday commencing at the hour of six pm 2 except as provided in subsection b1 of this section whenever the date of a regular meeting shall fall on a legal holiday such meeting may be held on such holiday if determined by the council to be appropriate otherwise the meeting shall be rescheduled and held on the following tuesday at the hour of six pm 3 whenever the date of a regular meeting conflicts with another event deemed significant council may by resolution adopted by at least a twothirds majority of the full council change the date of a regular meeting from a monday to the following tuesday  provided that a copy of such resolution is published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city not sooner than twentyfive 25 days nor later than twenty 20 days prior to the date of the rescheduled regular meeting c all regular or special meetings of the city council shall be held in the council room at the caon city municipal building unless the mayor or three 3 councilmembers acting jointly designates that a meeting shall be held at a different location if a meeting is held at a different location notice thereof shall be posted on the front door of the municipal building on or before the date and time of such meeting d special meetings of the council may be called by three 3 councilmembers acting jointly or by the mayor or mayor pro tem in the absence of the mayor with the concurrence of three 3 councilmembers  provided that notice of any such special meeting shall be given to all councilmembers who have not concurred in the calling of the meeting at least twentyfour 24 hours before such meeting such notice may be given by letter or written message delivered to the home of a councilmember or by personal telephone communication to a councilmember         council meetingsadministrator authority the city administrator shall have charge of the council room and shall attend the meetings of the council   council meetingsduties of mayor and mayor pro tem the mayor shall be the chief executive officer of the city and exofficio president of the council and shall preside at all meetings of the council when present the mayor shall vote upon all questions in case of a tie but not otherwise when the mayor shall be out of the city or unable to act because of disability the mayor pro tem shall exercise the same powers authority and duties as the mayor the mayor pro tem shall preside when the mayor does not attend a meeting of the council but unlike the mayor the mayor pro tem shall have the right and obligation to vote on all matters presented during any meeting of the council at which the mayor pro tem presides     council meetingsrules of order a the maintenance of order rules of procedure and order of business in all respects not specifically provided in this chapter shall be in accordance with rules that the council may from time to time adopt b roberts rules shall govern all questions not determined by this chapter or rules of council adopted pursuant to this section c the rules of order of council shall be strictly adhered to by the council and shall be amended or suspended only by a twothirds vote of the members present   order of business at the hour appointed for meeting the members shall be called to order and the city clerk shall proceed to call the roll note the absentees and announce whether a quorum is present upon the appearance of a quorum the council shall then continue with the business before them which shall be conducted in the following order a first the council shall correct and approve the minutes of the last preceding meeting the reading of the minutes shall be dispensed with if a copy thereof has been made available to each member of the council at least two 2 days prior to the meeting at which the same shall be approved and if copies thereof are available for public inspection in the council chambers at the time of the meeting b second the council shall adopt with or without amendment the agenda for the meeting the agenda shall be prepared in advance of the meeting by the mayor with the assistance of the city administrator and the city clerk c third council shall proceed with the rest of the business pursuant to the agenda that has been adopted   addressing the chair any member desirous of speaking shall address the presiding officer but shall not proceed further until recognized and named by the presiding officer   precedence of motions when a question is under debate no motion shall be received but to adjourn to lay on the table for the previous question to postpone to a day certain to commit to amend or to postpone indefinitely which several motions shall have precedence in the order in which they are arranged   quorum four 4 members of the council constitute a quorum to do business at all meetings of the council but a minority may adjourn from day to day and compel the attendance of the absent members by any lawful means   voting procedureopen voting and when voting may be excused a with respect to all matters requiring formal action all votes of city council must be by roll call or by another means which clearly identifies the vote of each member and results in the announcement and recording of each such vote b every councilmember and in case of a tie the mayor shall be required to vote on all matters presented unless such person believes he has a conflict of interest or potential conflict of interest with regard to the action under consideration whereupon the person shall state the reason he does not believe his or her vote should be cast in which case the remainder of the council shall determine whether or not such person should be excused from voting     preservation of order the mayor or person presiding shall preserve order and decide questions of order subject to an appeal to the council the city attorney shall act as parliamentarian to the mayor and council   standing committees a the council may establish by ordinance or resolution standing committees of council such committees shall be created and function with regard to matters involving the operation of city government and the provision of city services to the public b at the time the council establishes standing committees of council it shall specify the duties of each committee and determine the number of councilmembers to sit upon each committee the mayor shall be an exofficio and voting member of each standing committee   study committees a the mayor on his or her own initiative or when directed to do so by council action may establish special committees for the purpose of studying specific issues b study committees may be composed of both councilmembers and such other members as the mayor may designate in establishing such committees the mayor and in the case of committees established at the direction of council the council shall set forth the general duties of each committee so established   appointment and reports of committees all committees shall be appointed by the mayor committees shall report in writing when so ordered by the council and all written reports shall be addressed to the city council of the city of caon city   appointments to offices in all instances where council is required by of the charter of the city of caon city to make appointments to office the majority of the council shall be necessary for such appointment    city administrator  authority powers and duties pursuant to the authority vested in it by of of of the charter of caon city the council delegates to the city administrator the following authority powers and duties and defines the authority powers and duties of the city administrator as follows a to appoint and remove all employees of the city  provided that city appointive and legislative officers members of the planning commission members of the board of adjustment members of the library association or its board of directors and members of any other board or bureau serving the city without pay shall not be considered employees of the city within the meaning of this chapter all appointments as made shall be made subject to salary or wage limitations fixed by the council  b to act as chief conservator of the peace and to supervise the enforcement of all city ordinances and all penal and administrative laws of the state and united states to the extent that the city is required so to do or permitted so to do in the proper administration of city government  c to supervise all administrative departments and all other departments for which he appoints the heads or directors  d to keep the council advised of the immediate financial and administrative needs of the city and from time to time of the anticipated or future needs of the city  e to make such recommendations to the council concerning the affairs of the city as may appear to him to improve the administration of city affairs  f to prepare and submit to the council such reports as it may require  g to supervise all inspections required under city ordinances or the laws of colorado  h to abate all nuisances except in cases where this authority shall conflict with the authority of any other city officer or a state officer or board having exclusive jurisdiction in the matter  i to supervise the care and maintenance of all buildings and structures owned or controlled by the city and of all public streets avenues boulevards alleys bridges viaducts sidewalks curbs and gutters and thoroughfares and all construction thereof and all improvements and repairs thereto  j to supervise the operation care and maintenance of cemeteries owned or controlled by the city  k to supervise the operation care and maintenance of all public parks of the city  l to supervise and control the care maintenance and operation of the city waterworks and water system and to supervise the construction alteration or repair of any facility in the waterworks and water system  m to supervise the planting care and maintenance of shade trees shrubbery and lawns in public thoroughfares public parks and property owned or controlled by the city  n to supervise all public utilities operating in the city or furnishing any service commodity or convenience to the inhabitants of the city insofar as they are subject to control by the city under its charter or ordinances  o to be chief custodian of all personal property belonging to the city or which it may hold in trust and to make such periodic inventories and account thereof to the city council or other board officer or employee of the city as the council may by ordinance or resolution direct  to prevent as far as he is able to do so the misuse misappropriation and destruction of such property  and to require the heads of the departments and other officers and employees of the city to account to him periodically for all property entrusted to their use and care  provided that he shall not be personally liable to the city for any loss to the city because of the destruction misuse or misappropriation of any such property nor in case of theft or embezzlement thereof  p to prepare annually the city budget in accordance with the system and classification of accounts maintained by the director of finance as such system and classification shall be prescribed by the city council  q to present to the council or to such employees or officer as the council may direct all payrolls bills and claims of every nature against the city and see to it that the proper requisitions and vouchers are tendered and the required approval of the proper department head or officer procured before the same shall be submitted  r to make such investigation and inquiry with respect to payrolls bills and claims against the city before presenting them to the council as may be proper and necessary to determine the validity thereof  s subject to approval of the council by resolution duly adopted to establish administrative departments of the city and make changes in the administrative departments of the city as he may consider necessary to a proper and orderly administration of the citys affairs  t acting by or director of finance and in conjunction with such officer to collect all moneys due and owing to the city and when authorized by the council so to do to institute such suits and proceedings for the collection thereof as may be necessary for that purpose  u to draw and sign all warrants issued on behalf of the city authorized by the council provided that the director of finance shall countersign the same pursuant to of the charter  v to purchase all supplies and materials and to purchase rent or lease all equipment machines and apparatuses needed in the administration of the citys affairs subject to budgetary limitations and subject to of the charter and any other provisions of the charter in that regard  w to perform every function and duty and exercise every power which may be required of or granted to him by the council by motion or resolution incidental to the functions duties and powers above set forth   prior code    bond required the city administrator shall give bond executed by a reliable corporate security in such amount as the commission  authorization there is authorized by this chapter in accordance with crs the caon city planning commission except as superseded or modified by this chapter the provisions of parts 2 and 3 title 31 crs shall be applicable to the planning commission   purpose the purpose of the planning commission is to assist advise and coordinate with the city council with respect to the comprehensive study and review of issues relative to the planning zoning and growth of the municipality as more specifically set forth in this as provided in additional ordinances rules and regulations of the city promulgated by the city council the planning commission shall encourage coordinated and harmonious development of the municipality in accordance with the master plan zoning ordinance and subdivision regulations of the city   powers a the planning commission shall be empowered and authorized to review act upon and advise the city council with respect to all zoning rezoning planning subdividing platting annexation and other related activities as provided in the zoning and subdivision ordinances and regulations of the city b the planning commission is empowered to make and submit to the city council for the councils approval a master plan and any comprehensive amendments thereto for the physical development of the municipality the planning commission shall initiate a comprehensive review of the master plan no less often than once annually the master plan for the city and its environs shall contain the planning commissions recommendations with respect to the following matters 1 a comprehensive zoning and subdivision ordinance together with a zoning plan  2 appropriate plans showing the general location character and extent of streets bridges boulevards parkways and other types of transportation corridors within and without the city and its environs  3 a plan for the location and extent of public utilities including but not limited to water and sewer development public communications gas and electrical extensions together with the location and extent of other public improvements to be created within the city such as parks fire departments police stations schools and other public buildings  4 any and all plans for the eventual redesignation of specific areas within the community condemnation plans change of use plans or other alterations regarding the existing community structure c the planning commission is empowered with any and all further powers delineated within title 31 crs and any and all of the powers and duties granted to a municipal zoning commission within title 31 crs   duties it shall be the duty of the planning commission to proceed expeditiously in accordance with the purposes and powers enumerated in this chapter to communicate coordinate and advise the city council of its activities and accomplishments to hold public meetings in conjunction therewith to promulgate its own internal rules and regulations that are not in conflict with the charter and ordinances of the city and to provide a public forum for discourse and proceedings concerning the further development and orderly growth of the city   membership a 1 the planning commission shall consist of eight members each of whom shall be appointed by city council seven public members shall be residents of the city who are not members of city council or city planning staff public members shall be entitled to vote on all matters coming before the commission and shall be counted when the presence of a quorum is to be determined  2 the eighth member of the planning commission shall be a member of city council and be designated a municipal member the municipal member shall have no voting rights and shall not be counted when the presence of a quorum is to be determined b all members of the commission shall serve as such without compensation and the public members shall hold no other municipal office any public member of the commission may also be a member of the zoning board of adjustment c all members of the commission shall be bona fide residents of the city at the time of appointment and the discontinuance of residency shall immediately terminate membership d the municipal member shall be appointed to a oneyear term each july and serve until july 1st of the following year  provided that if such municipal members term on the city council ends prior to the expiration of such term the municipal members position shall become vacant immediately and be filled as provided in a e initially the terms of all public members shall begin upon their appointment in 200 following the adoption of the ordinance codified in this chapter provided that the terms of two such public members shall expire on   the terms of two such public members shall expire on   and the terms of three such public members shall expire on  thereafter the terms of all public members will be three years and in succession each such term shall expire on july 1st of that year which is three years from the date upon which the term began f members including the municipal member may be removed after public hearing before the city council for inefficiency neglect of duty or malfeasance in office in which case the council shall file a written statement of the reasons for the removal of such member   selection a any vacancy occurring other than expiration of the term of a member shall be filled for the remainder of the unexpired term by appointment by the city council any such appointment shall be made within ninety days following the creation of the vacancy b vacancies created by term expiration shall be filled by appointment by the city council prior to july 15th of the year during which the vacancy occurred the expiration of a term shall create a vacancy without regard to whether the incumbent wishes to be reappointed c when a vacancy to be filled under of this section pertains to the unexpired term of a public member notice seeking applications of qualified persons desiring to serve out the balance of such term shall be solicited at least thirty days prior to the date upon which the appointment to the vacant position is to be made d whenever the terms of public members are set to expire requests for applications to fill the vacancies on the commission that will be created by the expiration of such terms shall be published no sooner than sixty nor fewer than thirty days prior to the expiration of such terms incumbent public members of the commission whose terms are set to expire may apply and be considered for reappointment   chairperson the planning commission shall elect from its public members a chairperson for a oneyear term of office for the purpose of officiating at meetings of the planning commission the chairperson shall retain his or her voting rights   meetings the planning commission shall schedule and hold whenever there is business to come before the commission regular public meetings not less often than once per calendar month no official meeting shall take place unless a quorum is present when a quorum is not present a majority of those public members who are present may authorize the chairperson to continue the meeting to a date certain but shall conduct no other business a majority vote of the public members entitled to vote at a meeting where a quorum is present shall be required for all approvals recommendations and other official actions of the commission the commission may adopt rules of procedure for its meetings which shall constitute official protocol   rules the planning commission may adopt rules which shall be binding upon its members   record keeping the planning commission shall maintain a record of its resolutions transactions findings determinations recommendations and other activities which record regularly shall be presented to and reviewed by the city council the record shall be maintained for public inspection during normal working hours at the municipal office for the city   advisory capacity except as specifically may be provided to the contrary in the citys zoning ordinance title 17 of this all recommendations decisions determinations zoning and master plans regulations ordinance drafting and other actions taken by the planning commission are advisory in nature to the city council and as such shall neither be binding upon the city council nor subject to judicial review in all instances wherein parts 1 2 and 3 title 31 crs vest the planning or zoning commission with specific powers to make final decisions this chapter shall prevail and all such actions shall constitute recommendations and advice to the city council rather than final actions planning commission recommendations that are made in accordance with the requirements of the citys charter ordinances and regulations shall be given great weight by the city council   planning staff a the city shall furnish for all regular and special meetings of the planning commission and for all workshops if requested in advance by the chairperson a recording secretary who shall call the roll  tally and record all votes  prepare the official minutes of the commission  and maintain such official minutes and all other official records of proceedings before the planning commission b the city planner under the direction of the city administrator shall provide technical and advisory support to the commission as one of the city planners primary duties c other members of the citys professional staff including but not necessarily limited to the city engineer and city attorney shall be made available by the city to provide reasonable and routine assistance to the commission the level and extent of their participation shall be as determined by the city administrator who shall take into account the requests and expectations of the commission and its chairperson when making such determinations d the commission may request and the city may agree to provide outside professional consultants to assist the commission when circumstances warrant   scope of chapter this chapter designates the purposes powers and duties of the planning commission the provisions of the statutory authority shall be applicable only in the instance of silence of this chapter or where the general intent of the legislature as to scope and authority deemed proper for a planning commission can lend meaningful direction and assistance in the interpretation of this chapter  appeals of administrative decisions  appeal rights and procedures a city council appeals to the city council shall be made as set out in this subsection appeals to city council are only authorized when expressly provided for in this section 1 any aggrieved person upon receipt of written notice of the determination or decision of an administrative official may in writing and within thirty 30 days after receiving such notice request a hearing on the matter before the city council when specifically authorized to do so by this section the city clerk shall notify the appellants in writing return receipt requested or by electronic mail at least ten 10 days prior to the hearing date of the time and date of the hearing to be held not more than thirty 30 days from receipt of the notice the decision of the city council upon such hearing shall be final subject to judicial review 2 such request for hearing shall contain at least the following a a brief statement of the order or action being appealed  b a brief statement of any material facts supporting the appeal  c a brief statement of the relief being sought ie the order or action should be reversed modified or otherwise set aside and why the relief should be granted  and d the signatures of all persons appealing the decisions and their mailing addresses b appeals to board of adjustment appeals to the board of adjustment shall be made in accordance with this appeals to city administrator appeals to the city administrator shall be made as set out in this subsection 1 any aggrieved person upon receipt of written notice of the determination or decision of an administrative official may in writing and within ten 10 days after receiving such notice submit a written request for appeal to the city administrator when specifically authorized to do so by this such request for appeal shall contain at least the following a a brief statement of the order or action being appealed  b a brief statement of any material facts supporting the appeal  c a brief statement of the relief being sought ie the order or action should be reversed modified or otherwise set aside and why the relief should be granted  and d the signatures of all persons appealing the decision and their mailing addresses d failure of any person to file a timely appeal in accordance with the provisions of this section shall constitute a waiver of the right to an appeal e only those matters or issues specifically raised in the written appeal shall be considered by the appellate body or official f the decisions of the city council board of adjustment and city administrator shall be made in writing and shall contain findings of fact and any conditions within thirty 30 days after the hearing or decision as applicable a copy of the decision shall be sent return receipt requested or by electronic mail to the appealing party and the administrative body or official of the city whose decision has been the subject of the appeal   application of chapter provisions the provisions of this chapter shall supersede all other appeal procedures provided for elsewhere in either the ordinances of the city or any codes adopted by the city by reference or otherwise the procedures provided for in this chapter are not applicable to matters addressed in the personnel regulations of the city including grievances and interpretation of agreements between the city and its employees which matters must be determined grievance procedures prior to any employee appealing any employment decision to the city council or the courts  employees pensions  social security insurance coverage for city personnel the city is authorized to execute and deliver to the department of employment security of the state a plan or plans and agreement required under colorado revised statutes 1973 the social security act to extend coverage to employees and officers of the city and to do and perform any and all necessary acts or things necessary to effectuate coverage of employees and officers under the old age and survivors insurance system   social security contributionspayroll deductions the director of finance is authorized to establish a system of payroll deductions to be matched by payments of the city to be made into the contribution fund of the social security act department of employment security and to make charges of this tax to the fund or funds from which wage or salary payments are paid and issued to employees of the city such payments shall be made in accordance with the provisions of of the federal insurance contribution act on all services which constitute employment within the meaning of that act payments shall be made to the department of employment security of the state of colorado and shall be due and payable on or before the eighteenth day of the month immediately following the completed calendar quarter and such payments as are delinquent shall bear interest at the rate of onehalf percent per month until such time as payments are made   social security contributionsappropriations there is appropriated from the contingent fund and from any proper fund or funds hereafter established for this purpose of the city the necessary amount required to pay into the contribution fund as provided in colorado revised statutes 197   exclusions from chapter provisions this chapter shall not affect or be applicable to any department of the city government of the city or the employees thereof which is now operating under or is subject to any retirement or pension plan now in operation under the laws of the state  city parkscity cemetery  parks departmentsuperintendent there shall prior code    payment for grave space and interment the full purchase price and all interment charges as prescribed by resolution of the city council as provided by for each grave space shall be paid before any permanent monument cross emblem or marker of any kind shall be placed upon such grave space any interment placed prior to full payment of cemetery fees is temporary and this right shall not be acquired by the purchaser of the interment space until all amounts owing the city have been paid in full grave spaces reserved for future use may be purchased by payment within six months   prior code    report of parks superintendentfees all charges for use of city park facilities or equipment and all charges relating to burial and administration of the city cemeteries shall be paid to the
