negotiated tap fees reductions and payment arrangements for certain industrial and commercial users 1 it is the citys policy to encourage industrial and commercial growth within the city and its urban growth boundaries in aid of such policy and in cases where a clear public purpose exists or where a clear public benefit will be achieved the city council may negotiate with applicants for water taps who request reduced tap fees or who wish to make arrangements for the deferred payment of portions of their water tap fees 2 the city council shall by resolution specify guidelines and standards which must be followed and met by applicants seeking to negotiate agreements for reduced tap fees or payment arrangements under this subsection 3 nothing in this subsection will require city council to agree to reduce the tap fee for any person or project 4 all agreements negotiated pursuant to the provisions of this shall be in writing and be signed by the property owner acquiring the subject water tap permit any such agreement that obligates or may obligate the property owner andor the property owners successors in interest to make future payments shall run with the land and be recorded at the property owners expense j fees for increase in tap size for any increase in the size of an existing tap accomplished by abandoning or removing an existing tap and installing a new tap in its place the user who receives the larger tap shall pay to the water department the difference between the tap fee for the new tap as determined by reference to the appropriate schedule of appendix 1308 and the tap fee for the abandoned or removed tap as determined by reference to the same schedule and the size of the abandoned or removed tap no request for a new tap of increased size will be honored in the absence of such payment all new meters or fixtures installed pursuant to a request made under this subsection shall be equipped with appropriate back flow prevention devices specified by the water department and paid for by the applicant no refund will be made by the water department when an existing tap is removed and replaced with a tap of lesser size additionally when a user applies to increase the size of a tap located outside the corporate limits of the city the water department may require that a new water service contract be executed and performed as a condition to allowing the requested increase in tap size k fire protection in the event a water user wishes to tap a city water main for the purpose of conveying or furnishing water to a structure solely for fire protection purposes and upon the user showing to the satisfaction of the city engineer that the service line from such additional tap is solely for fire protection purposes a fire protection water tap permit will be issued for which the user shall pay no tap fee the water user will however be required to install a double check detector assembly in a vault at the property line on the fire line or at another location approved by the water superintendent if any service line earmarked for fire protection shall at any time be used to deliver water for any purpose other than fire protection or suppression the water superintendent may order the water user to pay the applicable tap fee for the connection used to deliver water for such other purpose as determined with respect to the appropriate schedule of appendix 1308 if such order is given the tap fee shall become immediately due and payable by the water user nonpayment of such tap fee within thirty 30 days of such order shall be grounds for termination of all water service to the property of the water user l city facilities unless otherwise ordered by formal action of city council no tap fee will be charged with respect to the connection of a new cityowned or controlled park green space building structure or facility to the water system in addition no tap fee shall be payable with respect to increasing the number or size of existing water taps serving any cityowned or controlled park green space building structure or facility m correctional facilities tap fees with respect to correctional facilities shall be established by written contract including but not necessarily limited to the mutual benefit water service agreement dated  between the city and the state of colorado acting by and colorado department of corrections     abandonment of water tap permits and water taps a abandonment of water tap permitscredit if a water tap permit is issued with respect to a lot or parcel upon which the applicant proposes to construct a structure such permit will conclusively be deemed abandoned and become void upon the following occurrences 1 if a building permit for such structure has not been issued within six 6 months following the date the water tap permit was issued  or 2 if the structure covered by a building permit issued within the six 6 months after the date the water tap permit was issued is not complete and a certificate of occupancy has not been issued within two 2 years following the date the water tap permit was issued in such event the applicant shall be entitled to reapply for a new water tap permit for the same lot or parcel and if such permit is thereafter issued the applicant shall be granted a credit against the tap fee payable with respect to the new application in an amount equal to ninety percent 90% of the amount of the tap fee paid at the time the abandoned water tap permit was issued no tap fee with respect to an abandoned permit shall be refunded if a physical connection to a service meter has been made b voluntary abandonment of water tap permits if an owner of a lot or parcel determines to abandon a previously issued water tap permit and if no physical connection to the propertys service meter has been made upon application by the owner the city shall refund ninety percent 90% of the amount of the tap fee originally paid to the owner c abandonment of previously valid taps any previously valid connection to the department water system will be deemed abandoned and null and void for all purposes if the site or structure previously receiving water service or entitled to receive water service has been disconnected or turned off for a period of twelve 12 or more consecutive months beginning on any date after  unless during such period meter charges andor account maintenance fees provided for in plus applicable interest andor other accrued charges if any have been paid in full with respect to all months during which the water service was disconnected or turned off the owner of property where a previously valid water tap was abandoned shall be treated as an applicant for new water service for all purposes under this chapter if such owner seeks to have water service restored to such owners property d removal of abandoned appurtenances and facilities the department is authorized to remove all appurtenances and facilities associated with abandoned water taps including but not limited to appurtenances and facilities that are not evidenced by any open and active water service account maintained by the department taps shall be physically disconnected from the main by plugging capping or sealing in accordance with the departments specifications in such cases the meter meter pit andor shutoff also shall be removed the property owner shall be responsible for all costs associated with the disconnection from time to time the department may find and remove abandoned taps fixtures and appurtenances at its own expense for the benefit of the water system as a whole e removal of unauthorized appurtenances and facilities the department is authorized to remove all appurtenances and facilities associated with unauthorized andor illegal water taps including but not limited to appurtenances and facilities that are not evidenced by any open and active water service account maintained by the department and a valid water tap permit       water service charges based on meter measurement and water a meter charges except as otherwise might be provided in this chapter every water user whose property or structure is physically connected to the water system shall pay a periodic meter charge for the privilege of being connected to the water system such meter charge shall be calculated with respect to the size of the water meter serving such property or structure and shall be billed and payable without regard to whether any water was actually consumed by the water user during the applicable billing period meter charges shall be assessed and billed either monthly or quarterly depending upon the rate classification of the water user as reflected in the various water rate schedules set forth in appendix 1308 to this meter charges shall be assessed billed and payable notwithstanding any discontinuation of water service that is requested by a water user or imposed by the department with respect to the failure of a water service customer who is connected to the water system to pay fees and charges payable pursuant to the provisions of this b water consumption charges based upon metered usage in addition to the applicable meter charge all water users shall be charged for water delivered to them by the department according to meter measurement charges with respect to such water consumption shall be calculated billed and payable in accordance with the rates provided for in the various schedules appended to this as the same may be amended from time to time c monthly account maintenance fee 1 a monthly account maintenance fee shall be charged to and payable by any person holding a valid water tap permit for the period beginning with the purchase of the water tap permit and ending when a physical connection of the property identified in such water tap permit to a department water main has been made or such water tap permit has been abandoned pursuant to following the making of such connection periodic meter charges and water consumption rates calculated in accordance with the applicable rate schedule appended to this shall become billable and payable with respect to such water service customer 2 subject to the provisions of persons holding or claiming to hold a valid water tap permit with respect to a property that was previously connected to the water system but which is no longer connected to the water system shall be billed and shall pay a monthly account maintenance fee in order to retain any rights for such property to be reconnected to the water system 3 persons holding a valid water tap permit with respect to a property that is connected to the water system shall be charged and pay applicable meter charges notwithstanding that no water is delivered or consumed water service connection any such permit holder may voluntarily abandon any rights under the water tap permit and relinquish any and all rights to future water service based upon such abandoned water tap permit by executing and delivering to the department a notice of intent to abandon on a form prepared or approved by the department and thereafter be relieved of all future fees and charges associated with the abandoned water service connection as an alternative to abandonment such permit holder may disconnect from the water system by causing the removal of the water meter and appurtenances associated with the physical connection of the property of the permit holder to the water system provided that such disconnection is accomplished in accordance with the requirements of the department after written permission to make such disconnection has been obtained from the department following any such disconnection the permit holder shall become obligated to timely pay monthly account maintenance fees in order to retain rights under the water tap permit and shall be subject to the provisions of abandonment d nonpayment of meter charges or monthly account maintenance fees whichever is applicable together with all accrued fees charges late charges and other sums then owing for a period of twelve 12 consecutive months will be conclusive evidence of a water users intention to abandon any rights to continued or future water service based upon a previouslyissued water tap permit   ratesinside water users a inside residential rates inside users group user water rates shall apply with respect to water sold and delivered to any municipality other than the city special district or other entity regulated by the colorado public utilities commission that distributes water purchased from the department to water users within its jurisdiction water distribution system operated by such municipality special district or other entity examples of group users include the town of brookside and the orchard park water district water rates applicable to group users are those provided for in schedule j of appendix 1308 b golf course rates because golf courses within the departments water service area have been and will remain open to public play by local inhabitants offer unique recreational opportunities enhance quality of life generate tourism and otherwise foster growth and economic development the department has deemed it to be in the public interest for water rates charged to golf courses to have been less than prevailing rates charged to other nonresidential water users it is the departments goal to bring water rates for golf courses into parity with those applicable to other nonresidential water users and uses but the department seeks to achieve such parity over a period of years in order to avoid situations where increased costs of water coupled with other difficult economic circumstances could force the closure of one or more golf courses and the communitys loss of those unique public benefits enumerated in this subsection accordingly unless otherwise specified by valid contract water rates for all water sold by the department to golf courses shall be as set forth in schedule k of appendix 1308 c city rates city rates shall apply with respect to all water sold and delivered to the city of caon city including its divisions and departments regardless of location and shall be calculated and billed in accordance with the provisions of schedule l of appendix 1308 d correctional facilities rates charged for water service provided to correctional facilities within the city shall be inside nonresidential rates as provided for in schedule e of appendix 1308 rates charged for water service temporary water service authorized pursuant to be calculated and billed in accordance with the provisions of schedule o of appendix 1308   malfunctioning water meters a if with respect to any billing cycle applicable to any water user it becomes apparent that the water meter intended to measure such users water consumption during such billing cycle became damaged broken inoperable or otherwise malfunctioned in a manner clearly suggesting that such water users actual consumption during the billing cycle as measured by such damaged or defective water meter was understated for the billing cycle such water users charges for that billing cycle shall be estimated by the department based upon historic consumption records for the same location b the water superintendent shall establish the formula or method by which water charges will be estimated under circumstances described in of this section the director of finance shall have the discretion to waive or reduce water charges in excess of minimum charges for the applicable billing cycle for good cause shown by any water users whose charges were estimated pursuant to the terms of this section   water surcharge zone fees a there are established certain water surcharge zones within the departments water service area water surcharge zones are areas within which water users are served with water pumped at the departments expense after such water leaves the departments water treatment plant the department is hereby authorized to charge water surcharge zone fees to its customers within such water surcharge zones water surcharge zones shall include the following 1 zone ia shall include territory within which water users receive water that is pumped once at the departments expense departments #1 booster pump station before it is delivered to water users within such territory 2 zone ib shall include territory within which water users receive water that is pumped once at the departments expense departments north 9th street pump station before it is delivered to water users within such territory 3 zone ic shall include territory within which water users receive water that is pumped once at the departments expense departments four mile ranch pump station before it is delivered to water users within such territory 4 zone ii zone ii shall include territory within which water users receive water that is pumped twice at the departments expense departments #1 and #2 booster pump stations after such water leaves the water treatment plant and before it is delivered to water users within such territory 5 zone iii zone iii shall include territory within which water users receive water that is pumped three 3 times at the departments expense #1 and #2 booster pump stations and then greenhorn pump station after such water leaves the water treatment plant and before it is delivered to water users within such territory b water surcharge zone maps the city engineer shall prepare maintain and modify when warranted a water system map clearly indicating the boundaries of all territory included with each water surcharge zone described and designated in subsection a of this section such maps shall be made available for public inspection at city hall during normal business hours c zone surcharge fees water users within the various water surcharge zones shall be charged on their periodic water billing statements for zone surcharge fees calculated by multiplying the water users actual water consumption for the billing period times the applicable zone surcharge rate zone surcharge fees shall be in addition to all other charges payable by such water users d zone surcharge rates zone surcharge rates shall be based upon costs of electricity and the calculation thereof may also include costs of equipment maintenance associated labor and depreciation that are specific to the pump station or stations that serve the applicable water surcharge zone rates to be used to calculate water zone surcharge fees shall be those set forth in schedule p of appendix 1308   impact fees a the city council from time to time may establish and the department may charge impact fees to applicants for water service to properties located within certain areas impacted by development impact areas that are within the service area of the water department in order to recover costs incurred by the department to pay for improvements made by the department to ensure the departments ability to provide adequate water service to users within such impact areas b the territory and rates to be included within each impact area shall be as provided for in schedule q of appendix 1308 c the engineer shall prepare and maintain an impact area map or maps clearly indicating the boundaries of all territory included within each impact area territory included within an impact area need not be contiguous with other territory included in the same or in any separate impact area d impact fees provided for in this section if not previously paid by a prior owner or developer shall be billed to individual applicants for water service at the time such applicants apply for a water tap permit no water tap permit shall be issued until both the impact fee and the applicable tap fee have been paid in full such impact fees shall be in addition to the applicants tap fee e when impact fees provided for in this section are imposed as a condition of approval for a subdivision or other land development which shall be the ordinary and preferred way of imposing the impact fees provided for in this section the developer of such subdivision or other land development shall pay as a lump sum and prior to the recording of the subdivision plat all impact fees with respect to all lots within the subdivision the amount to be paid by such developer shall be determined by multiplying the applicable perlot impact fee times the anticipated number of water taps to be made available by the department for use within the subdivision impact fees shall be in addition to all other charges payable by the developer andor water user f when city council permits a planned development a planned unit development district a subdivision or other land development to be developed in phases the impact fee payable by the developer will be calculated and payable on a phasebyphase basis taking into account the number of water taps to be made available in each phase unless city council provides otherwise in its ordinance or resolution approving the subdivision or other land development g as to each impact area with respect to which impact fees may be collected the engineer shall prepare maintain and make available for public inspection accurate and reliable records with respect to costs incurred by the department that are recoverable imposition and collection of impact fees pursuant to this section records reflecting impact fees actually collected also shall be kept and updated periodically by the engineer h any person who has paid a rebate to the department pursuant to the provisions of of be entitled to a credit equal to the amount of such rebate payment against an impact fee imposed pursuant to the provisions of this section if such rebate payment pertained to the same water system improvements that gave rise to the departments costs that were used to determine the impact fees to be imposed pursuant to this section the purpose of this subsection is to ensure that no property owner including successors in interest pays for the same water system improvements twice   fees for the performance of the services for which the fee was charged the director shall consider waiving or reducing fees pursuant to this subsection when department services associated with the fee were performed in connection with an emergency or as a result of extraordinary climatic or natural conditions the authority and discretion herein granted to the director of finance may be delegated on a or similar group or entity the association formed by such unit owners may be treated by the department as the owner of such property for all purposes under this title 13 b all billings of charges and fees for water service provided by the department shall be prepared in the name of be mailed to and be payable by the owner of the real property where the water service is provided regardless of whether such owner occupies the real property accounts for water service will not be established in the names of tenants requests made for turn on or turn off of water service made by tenants will not be honored by the department except in cases of extreme emergency as determined by the water superintendent or designee the department also will not honor requests that are made by tenants for the rereading or testing of water meters or for any final meter reading   lien by cityamounts due the city shall have a lien upon all real estate to which the department sells and delivers water for the amounts of all water charges fees and assessments owing to the department for and with respect to such water and water service such lien shall commence when such charges fees and assessments shall become due and shall remain a lien until the same are paid in full all such liens shall run with the land where water service was delivered by the department   lien by cityowner notification all water supplied by the department shall be deemed to have been supplied at the instance and request of the owners of the property so supplied such owners and all persons claiming by under such owners shall be deemed to have notice of such lien whether the property is occupied by an owner tenant or any other person   late charges and interest a in the event any sum due the department for water sold or as schedule s to appendix 1308 as adopted no 23 series of 201 with respect to water consumed on and after  stormwater utility  codealert this topic has been affected by  to view amendments and newly added provisions please refer to the codealert amendment list  title this chapter shall be known and cited as the stormwater utility caon city   findings legislative intent and purpose and authority a the city council finds and determines that 1 due to its general terrain and geographical location property within the city is particularly subject to damage from floods and stormwater which from time to time overflow existing watercourses and stormwater facilities  and that the citys existing stormwater facilities are inadequate to control such overflow and other runoff or to prevent flooding in many parts of the city during and following certain storm events 2 the city maintains a system of storm and surface water management facilities including but not limited to inlets conduits manholes channels ditches drainage easements retention and detention basins and other components 3 the stormwater system in the city needs regular maintenance and improvements 4 water quality is degrading due to erosion and the discharge of nutrients metals oil grease toxic materials and other substances into and stormwater system 5 the city is currently permitted colorado water quality control act colorado stormwater discharge permit system to discharge stormwater to state waters provided that six 6 minimum measures are implemented within the next few years the six 6 minimum measures include a public education  b public involvement  c elimination of illicit discharges  d construction site erosion control  e post construction monitoring  and f municipal operations there is a cost involved with this unfunded mandate to implement these measures 6 the public health safety and welfare is adversely affected by poor ambient water quality and flooding that results from inadequate management of both the quality and quantity of stormwater 7 all real property in the city either uses or benefits from the maintenance of the stormwater system 8 the extent of use of the stormwater system by each property is dependant on factors that influence runoff including land use and the amount of impervious surface on the property 9 the costs of improving maintaining operating and monitoring the stormwater system should be allocated to the extent practicable to all property owners based on the impact of runoff from the impervious areas of their property on the stormwater management system 10 management of the stormwater system to protect the public health safety and welfare requires adequate revenues and it is in the interest of the public to finance stormwater management adequately with a user charge system that is reasonable and equitable so that each user of the system pays to the extent to which such user contributes to the need for it b it is the intent and purpose of the city council in enacting this chapter 1 to promote the public health safety and welfare by permitting the movement of emergency vehicles during storm or flooding periods and by minimizing storm and flood losses and the inconvenience and damage resulting from uncontrolled stormwater runoff in the city  2 to provide for the establishment and implementation of a master drainage plan for effective stormwater and flood management  3 to establish a stormwater utility enterprise to coordinate design construct manage operate and maintain the stormwater and flood management systems and stormwater projects and facilities  4 to establish reasonable stormwater utility service charges based on the use and availability of stormwater facilities  and 5 to encourage and facilitate urban water resources management techniques including without limitation detention of floods and stormwater runoff minimizing the need to construct stormwater facilities reduction of pollution and enhancement of the environment c the citys authority for the establishment of a stormwater utility enterprise and a stormwater utility fund and for the adoption of a system of charges to fund the citys stormwater utility enterprise is derived from of of the colorado constitution  of f of of the charter of caon city and of of title 31 crs   definitions for purposes of this chapter the following words shall have the following meanings unless the context clearly indicates otherwise a base rate means the base rate per square foot of impervious surface that is used to calculate stormwater management fee and stormwater impact fee charges for individual properties the base rates shall be calculated as provided in  b base unit means one square foot c combined utility statement means any single billing statement used by the city to periodically bill property owners for 1 water service charges pursuant to   and 2 stormwater management fees pursuant to this chapter d developed property means real property which has been altered from its natural state by the addition of any improvements such as buildings structures parking lots driveways or other impervious area e director means the city administrator or the city administrators designee f fiscal year means january 1 of a calendar year to december 31 of the same calendar year g grant means a cash payment of public funds or contribution of money made directly to the stormwater utility enterprise by a state or local governmental entity or district which is not required to be repaid grant does not include public funds paid or advanced to the stormwater utility enterprise in consideration for the provision of any goods services facilities rights or interest by the stormwater utility enterprise to a state or local governmental entity or district nor does grant include refunds made in the current or next fiscal year gifts any payments directly or indirectly from federal funds or earnings on federal funds whether or not the state or local governmental entity or district acts as a conduit for such payments collections for another governmental entity and any other payments or revenue excluded from the definition of grant under the colorado constitution or law h impervious surface area means the number of square feet of horizontal surface covered by buildings and other impervious surfaces all building measurements shall be made between exterior faces of walls foundations columns or other means of support or enclosure i impervious surface means a surface area which is compacted or covered with material that is resistant to infiltration by water including but not limited to most conventionally surfaced streets roofs sidewalks patios driveways parking lots and any other oiled compacted or other surface which impedes the natural infiltration of surface water j improvement means any works of man or manmade change to real property including but not limited to buildings or other similar structures streets parking lots driveways patio areas roofs sidewalks storage areas paving and compacted surfaces k new development means any improvement to property that is associated with andor requires a city building permit or development approval after  l property owner means the property owner of record of any lot or parcel against which stormwater management fees may be levied as listed in the records of the caon city water department or if not so listed as listed in the records of the park center water district if available if a property owners identity is neither listed nor available in such water department or district records the records of the fremont county treasurer shall be used to identify the property owner a property owner includes any individual corporation firm partnership or group of individuals acting as a unit and any trustee receiver or personal representative m revenue bonds means bonds notes or other obligations lawfully issued or otherwise contracted for payable from the revenues derived or to be derived from the functions services benefits or facilities of the stormwater utility enterprise or from other available funds of the stormwater utility enterprise n revenue requirement means the operating revenue projected for stormwater management programs of the stormwater utility enterprise as set forth in the citys annual budgets for the stormwater utility fund o runoff means that part of snowfall rainfall or other stormwater which is not absorbed transpirated evaporated or left in surface depressions and which then flows controlled or uncontrolled into a watercourse or body of water p stormwater facilities means any one or more of the various devices used in the collection disposition or treatment of storm flood or surface drainage waters including manmade structures and natural watercourses for the conveyance of runoff such as conduits and appurtenant features canals ditches streams gulches gullies flumes culverts streets curbs gutters detention areas pumping stations pipes and related equipment and appurtenances  all extensions improvements remodeling additions and alterations thereof and any and all rights or interest in such stormwater facilities q stormwater impact fee means the onetime charge established under assessed against new development to recover costs associated with the value of the city stormwater facilities r stormwater management means the planning design construction regulation improvement repair maintenance and operation of stormwater facilities and the stormwater system and also includes the establishment and operation of programs relating to water flood plains flood control grading erosion tree conservation and sediment control including but not necessarily limited to programs required by federal state or local law rule regulation or permit s stormwater management fee or fee means the monthly service charge payable by property owners that is established under assessed against lots parcels or pieces of developed property to fund stormwater management programs in the city t stormwater management programs means and includes all programs established operated maintained andor participated in by the city for purposes of stormwater management including specifically any programs required by federal state or local law rule regulation or permit u stormwater system means the system or network of stormwater facilities located in whole or in part within the city including but not limited to inlets conduits manholes channels ditches drainage easements retention and detention basins infiltration facilities and other components as well as all natural waterways v undeveloped property means any property which has no impervious surface area and for purposes of this chapter shall also mean all public streets owned or maintained by the city or state of colorado and all city parks w water means any stormwater surface water snow melt or ground water  3     stormwater utility enterprise a there is hereby created a stormwater utility in the city b the stormwater utility shall constitute an enterprise empowered to coordinate design conduct manage operate and maintain the stormwater and flood management systems and stormwater facilities of the city and to implement the provisions of this chapter the stormwater utility enterprise is authorized to issue its own revenue bonds the enterprise shall be wholly owned by the city and operated in accordance with the charter ordinances and resolutions of the city and other applicable law c the city council shall act ex officio as the governing body of the stormwater utility enterprise d the stormwater utility enterprise shall at all times and in all ways conduct its affairs so as to continue to qualify as a water activity enterprise within the meaning of crs and as an enterprise within the meaning of of of the colorado constitution specifically but not by way of limitation the stormwater utility enterprise is not authorized and shall not receive ten percent 10% or more of its annual revenue in grants so long as the stormwater utility enterprise continues to qualify as a water activity enterprise and as an enterprise the stormwater utility enterprise and all spending and revenue thereof shall not be subject to of of the colorado constitution   stormwater management fee beginning on  a monthly stormwater management fee shall be imposed upon all lots and parcels of developed property in the city to fund the citys stormwater management programs   classification of property for purposes of determination of the stormwater utility fee and calculation of stormwater management fees a for purposes of determining the stormwater management fee all properties in the city are classified into one of the two following classes 1 developed property  or 2 undeveloped property b developed property as to each lot or parcel of developed property the monthly stormwater management fee will be calculated by multiplying the amount of impervious surface area of such property expressed in square feet times the base rate c no fee for undeveloped property undeveloped property shall not be charged a stormwater management fee   base rate a the city council by ordinance shall establish and from time to time modify the monthly base rate to be used in calculating the stormwater management fee for individual properties the base rate shall be established at an amount intended to reasonably ensure the availability of funds needed to cover the costs of stormwater management programs in the city in accordance with the operating revenue requirement for these programs as reflected in the citys annual budgets for the stormwater utility fund b the base rate shall be calculated by 1 dividing the revenue requirement for stormwater management programs of the city for the applicable fiscal year by the aggregate of impervious surface area on developed property within the city existing at the time the base rate is calculated  and 2 by dividing the quotient thereof by twelve 12 c city council shall recalculate the base rate no less often than once annually such recalculation shall be conducted no later than sixty 60 days following the adoption of each annual budget   stormwater impact fee effective  a stormwater impact fee shall be imposed upon all new development in the city to recover capital costs of the citys stormwater facilities   calculation of stormwater impact fees for new development the stormwater impact fee will be calculated by multiplying the amount of new impervious surface area of such property expressed in square feet times base rate   base ratestormwater impact fee a the city council by ordinance shall establish and from time to time modify the base rate to be used in calculating the stormwater impact fee for new development the base rate shall be established at an amount intended to recover costs associated with the value of the citys stormwater facilities as reflected in the citys annual budgets for the stormwater utility fund b the base rate shall be calculated by dividing the value of the city stormwater facilities by the aggregate of impervious surface area on developed property within the city existing at the time the base rate is calculated   collection of stormwater impact fees payment of stormwater impact fees shall be due at time of a building permit application for new development a building permit will not be issued if the stormwater impact fee is not paid   stormwater utility fund a there is hereby created pursuant to f of of the charter a special fund designated as the stormwater utility fund which shall be separate and segregated from all other city funds all stormwater management fees paid and collected pursuant to this chapter shall be credited and deposited into the stormwater utility fund monies in the stormwater utility fund shall not be transferred therefrom to any other account of the city or used for any purpose other than as set forth in of this section b funds on deposit in the stormwater utility fund and income earned thereon shall be used only for the following purposes 1 the acquisition by gift purchase or condemnation of real and personal property and interests therein necessary to construct operate and maintain stormwater facilities  2 all costs of administration and implementation of the citys stormwater management program including the establishment of reasonable operating and capital reserves to meet unanticipated or emergency stormwater management requirements  3 engineering and design debt service and related financing expenses construction costs for new facilities and enlargement or improvement of existing facilities  4 operation and maintenance of the stormwater system  5 monitoring surveillance and inspection of stormwater control devices  6 water quality monitoring and water quality programs  7 retrofitting developed areas for pollution control  8 inspection and enforcement activities  9 billing and administrative costs  10 implementation of the six 6 minimum measures required under the colorado stormwater discharge permit 11 other activities which are either mandated or reasonably required to manage stormwater runoff within the city or to comply with applicable federal and state laws rules and regulations which regulate the flow treatment and discharge of runoff into the waters of the united states or the waters of the state of colorado   stormwater utility enterprise debt issuance a the stormwater utility enterprise is authorized to issue revenue bonds for the payment or other financing of eligible project costs or for the purpose of refunding any revenue bonds issued for such purpose such bonds shall be authorized by ordinance adopted by the city council in the same manner as other ordinances of the city and when required by the charter or ordinances of the city by an approving vote of the registered electors of the city at a general or special election called and conducted in accordance with the requirements of applicable law b the terms conditions and details of revenue bonds the procedures related thereto and the refunding thereof shall be set forth in the ordinance authorizing the revenue bonds each bond issued under this section shall recite in substance that said bond including the interest thereon is payable from the revenues and other available funds of the stormwater utility enterprise pledged for the payment thereof notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary such revenue bonds may be issued to mature at such times not beyond thirty 30 years from their respective issue dates shall bear interest at such rates and shall be sold at private or public sale at above or below the principal amount thereof all as shall be determined by the city council the powers provided in this section shall be in addition to and shall not modify limit or affect the powers conferred by any other law either directly or indirectly c the city may pledge all or any portion of the stormwater utility fund including revenues anticipated to be collected to the payment of principal interest premiums if any and reserves for revenue bonds issued for the payment or other financing of any of the activities of this chapter including but not limited to eligible project costs or for the purpose of refunding any revenue bonds issued for such purposes   billing and collection of stormwater management feescombined utility statement a stormwater management fees shall be determined on a monthly basis as a monthly charge but shall be billed to the owners of the affected property according to the provisions of this section b combined utility statements 1 in all situations where a property within the city is both connected to the citys water distribution system and assessed stormwater management fees the city shall bill for water charges and stormwater management fees on a single combined utility statement that will show water service charges if any and stormwater management fees for the applicable billing period or cycle 2 when billed on a combined utility statement stormwater management fees will be due and payable on the same date as water service charges for the same property are due and payable such due date shall be shown on the combined utility statement 3 in situations where water charges for the same property are billed and payable quarterly stormwater management fees respecting such property also will be billed and payable quarterly the amount thereof shall be calculated by multiplying the monthly stormwater management fee times three 3 4 in situations where water charges with respect to a property are billed and payable monthly the monthly stormwater management fee for the same property shall be billed and payable monthly 5 payments from owners of properties who receive a combined utility statement reflecting both stormwater management fees and water service charges will first be applied to satisfy all outstanding stormwater management fees and then to reduce or satisfy as the case may be outstanding charges for water service 6 delinquencies regarding charges on combined utility statements a as to any property with respect to which an unpaid stormwater management fee billed on a combined utility statement becomes delinquent the director of finance shall have the authority to order water service to be shut off provided that notice to the owner or occupant of such property shall first be given in the same manner as is provided for in respect to unpaid water charges b if water service is turned off pursuant to the authority granted in this subparagraph water service shall not be restored until all past due stormwater management fees water charges penalties and interest including turn off and turn on fees have been paid in full this remedy shall be in addition to and not in lieu of any other remedy available to the city with respect to the collection of unpaid stormwater management fees andor water charges c delinquent stormwater management fees shall be added to unpaid water charges if any for purposes of calculating late charges andor penalties associated with any delinquent balance owing with respect to charges on a combined utility statement c the procedures set forth in paragraphs 1 2 3 4 and 5 of this subsection shall apply in situations where the city does not provide water service to a developed lot or parcel located within the city 1 stormwater management fees will be billed to the owner of each such lot or parcel on a quarterly basis 2 payment of each stormwater management fee billed pursuant to this shall be due thirty 30 days following the date of each billing statement 3 the due date for payment of the fee shall be reflected on each billing statement 4 stormwater management fees shall be considered delinquent if not paid on or before their due date 5 a delinquent charge of five dollars $500 or one and onehalf percent 15% of the unpaid fee per month whichever is greater shall be assessed upon fees not paid in full on or before five pm on the due date for such payment as shown on the statement d the obligation to pay stormwater management fees shall not be affected by the failure of the owner to receive a bill or statement for such fees provided that such statements are actually mailed to the property owner at the address of the affected property or at such other mailing address as might be designated by such owner in writing e any stormwater management fee billed by the city shall constitute a lien against the property against which the stormwater management fee was assessed such liens shall attach on the due date of the fee and shall remain until the fee and all other charges related to delinquency in the payment of the fee have been paid in full   corrections or modifications of feesgrounds and documentation a property owners may request corrections revisions or modifications of the stormwater management fee assessed against their developed property such requests must be made in writing and must be based upon one or more of the following grounds 1 incorrect classification of the property for purposes of determining the fee  2 errors in the square footage of the impervious surface area of the property  3 mathematical errors in calculating the fee to be applied to the property  and 4 errors in the identification of the property owner of a property subject to the fee b the director shall make a determination with respect to any such request within thirty 30 days following his or her receipt of the property owners completed written request for correction of the fee c a property owner must comply with all rules and procedures adopted by the city when submitting a request for correction of the fee and must provide all information necessary for the director to make a determination on a request for correction of the fee d if a property owner alleges an error under a2 and requests a hearing pursuant to c the request for hearing must include a certification by a registered engineer or professional land surveyor of the impervious surface area of the property before a hearing date will be set failure to comply with the provisions of this subsection shall be grounds for denial of the request   administration and review a the administration of the provisions of this chapter is vested in and shall be exercised by the director who may prescribe forms and rules and regulations in conformity with this chapter for the proper administration and enforcement of this chapter the director may delegate the administration of this chapter or any part thereof to duly qualified persons in the department of public works the city engineers office andor the finance department b every decision or determination of the director shall be in writing and notice thereof shall be served upon or mailed by first class mail postage prepaid to the affected person at his or her address shown on the records of the city service by first class mail as provided herein shall be conclusive evidence of service of such decision or determination the decision or determination of the director shall be final and conclusive upon the affected person unless he or she timely files a petition for hearing c if the director has delegated administration pursuant to subsection a above any person aggrieved by any decision or determination of the designee may appeal to the city administrator for a hearing on revision or modification of such decision or determination no later than thirty 30 days after the date of the decision by the designee pursuant to c of this if the director has not delegated administration pursuant to subsection a above any person aggrieved by any decision or determination of the designee may appeal to the city council for a hearing on revision or modification of such decision or determination no later than ten 10 days after the date of the decision by the designee pursuant to a of this     nonliability of city runoff may occur which exceeds the capacity of citys stormwater facilities this chapter does not imply that real property liable for the charges and fees established herein will be free from runoff or flood damage nor shall this chapter create any liability on the part of or cause of action against the city or any officer or employee thereof for runoff or flood damage this chapter does not purport to reduce the need or necessity for obtaining flood insurance   reserved  cooperation with cesspool and septic tank restrictions a no person firm or corporation shall use or maintain any privy vault cesspool or septic tank for the storage or disposal of human excrement on any premises within the boundaries of any established sanitary sewer district in any case where a public sewer is available and accessible to the property b a sewer shall be deemed available to the property for the purposes of this chapter when it is under the control maintenance and supervision of the city in working order may be reached without crossing private property owned or controlled by a person or persons other than the property owner and when connection thereto from the property can be made in such manner as to adequately carry the sewage from the property c a sewer shall be deemed accessible for the purposes of this chapter when connection can be made thereto by constructing a sewer line from an available public sewer or another sewer belonging to the owner connected thereto a distance of one hundred and fifty 150 feet or less d provided that all persons firms or corporations maintaining any such vault cesspool or septic tank upon the date when such public sewer shall become available and accessible to the property shall have six 6 months within which to discontinue the use of such vault cesspool or septic tank and provide sewer connection to the property   grease traps required when waste pipes from kitchen sinks in any restaurant or cooking establishment shall run separately to a grease trap as provided in the state plumbing provided that the superintendent of the water and sewer department may require any commercial manufacturing or processing establishment which in his opinion is discharging into the sewers any substance likely to obstruct the sewer lines to install a grease trap as provided in the aforesaid state plumbing   provided further that no grease trap shall be required for private residences of any type or apartment houses where no cooking is done in excess of the ordinary family requirements  but where such premises now employ or continue using grease traps in connection therewith they shall be subject to all existing or future ordinances pertaining thereto   vault cleanerspermit required no person firm or corporation shall clean empty drain or otherwise remove carry away or dispose of the contents of any grease trap privy vault cesspool or septic tank except a person firm or corporation holding a vault cleaners or scavengers permit from the city authorizing such person firm or corporation so to do b  vault cleanersschedule of charges no person firm or corporation shall make any charge for cleaning or emptying any grease trap privy vault cesspool or septic tank in excess of the maximum or less than the minimum rates set forth in this section a grease traps 1 grease traps of a size not in excess of three and onehalf feet in depth and two feet in diameter and not lying beneath a paved walk or driveway or beneath a building a maximum charge of a six dollars and fifty cents for grease traps lying not more than eight inches beneath the surface  b seven dollars and fifty cents for grease traps lying more than eight inches but less than two feet beneath the surface 2 grease traps in excess of the size described in subparagraph ala above grease traps lying two feet or more beneath the surface and grease traps lying beneath a paved walk or driveway or beneath a building a charge not to exceed a sum equal to five dollars for each onehalf hour or fraction thereof of time employed in such work b privy vaults cesspools and septic tanks a charge not to exceed a sum equal to five dollars per ton for water removed and ten dollars per ton of sludge removed  provided however a minimum charge of twenty dollars shall be made in any event   inspectionsscheduled when a all grease traps in sewer outlets used by one family only shall be inspected at intervals of from fifteen to twenty months and all other grease traps at intervals of from five to seven months according to the convenience of the inspector b all privy vaults and cesspools shall be inspected at intervals of from twentyfour to thirty months according to the convenience of the inspector   inspectionsauthority all inspections required shall be made by an inspector appointed by the council and whose compensation shall be fixed by the council a  inspectionsfee and procedures a the owner of any premises on which is maintained a grease trap privy vault or cesspool shall pay to the city an inspection fee of fifty cents for each grease trap having a covering of less than eight inches and one dollar and fifty cents for each inspection of any other grease trap or any privy vault or cesspool  provided that if any such grease trap privy vault or cesspool shall be ordered emptied and cleaned by the owner or person in control of the property at or about the time such inspection is made no inspection charge shall be made b the inspector or vault cleaner as the case may be shall restore the apparatus and all soil and sod thereon to its former condition after each inspection or cleaning   inspectionsinterference unlawful no person firm or corporation owning or controlling any property shall prevent in any manner or impose conditions upon the inspection of any grease trap privy vault or cesspool   inspectionsreportnuisance conditions a upon making an inspection provided for in this chapter the inspector shall make out a statement on a printed form approved by the city administrator in duplicate upon which shall be written 1 the date of the inspection  2 the name of the owner of the property  3 the street number of the property  4 the apparatus inspected ie whether grease trap cesspool or privy vault  5 the condition of the apparatus inspected  and 6 whether the same is in need of cleaning emptying or repair in the opinion of the inspector c the inspector shall sign his name on each duplicate and deliver one duplicate to the owner or person in control of the property and the other to the finance officer d if the owner or person controlling the use of the property fails for a period of ten days after an inspection and the receipt of the inspectors report as aforesaid to make arrangements for cleaning emptying or repair of a grease trap cesspool or privy vault required to be cleaned emptied or repaired such owner or other person controlling the use of the property shall be and be deemed to be guilty of maintaining a nuisance and guilty of a misdemeanor a separate offense shall be deemed to be committed for each fortyeight hours expiring after the expiration of such tenday period during which such nuisance is maintained   nuisanceconditions designated no person firm or corporation shall use or maintain or permit to remain on premises owned or controlled by such person firm or corporation any privy vault cesspool or septic tank for the disposal of human excrement or any grease trap within the city which shall be in a foul leaking or otherwise defective condition and a menace to public health or which shall be filled to such extent that it has become a menace to the public health or no longer efficient in serving the purpose for which it was installed or in use grease traps cesspools septic tanks and privy vaults found to be in any such condition shall be and be deemed to be nuisances   nuisanceabatement costs the city shall have authority to abate any nuisance defined in this chapter by any appropriate means if such abatement shall consist of cleaning emptying or repair of any such grease trap cesspool septic tank or privy vault or when such cleaning emptying or repair is ordered by the owner or person controlling the property and such owner or person fails to pay the charges direct to the vault cleaner the cost thereof or charges therefor shall become due and payable with the next installment of water rent for the premises and the city shall have the same lien and remedies for enforcing payment thereof as is provided by city ordinance for the collection of water rents   discontinued facilities to be filled whenever any grease trap privy vault or cesspool is discontinued such grease trap privy vault or cesspool shall be cleaned to the bottom and filled up with earth or other suitable material  and such work shall be under the supervision of the superintendent of the water and sewer department   burial of wastes prohibited where no night soil or grease trap or cesspool matter shall be deposited or buried in or on any premises within the city limits of this city   violationreport by inspector the inspector shall make report from time to time of all violations of this chapter to the city administrator   violationmisdemeanor any person firm or corporation violating any provision of this chapter or maintaining any nuisance is guilty of a misdemeanor  utility rate cases  city intervention in rate cases authorized when the city council shall cause the city to formally intervene both for itself and its residents and citizens with the public utilities commission of the state or such successor agencies as may be designated in all rate cases initiated by utility companies holding franchise agreements with the city for the purpose of determining whether the proposed rates are lawful just reasonable nonprejudicial nonpreferential and nondiscriminatory   attorneys services authorized when the city council if there is substantial doubt as to whether the rate request is lawful just reasonable nonprejudicial nonpreferential or nondiscriminatory shall arrange the services of a qualified attorney to represent the interests of local consumers in such rate cases   appropriation of funds the city council shall annually budget a sum equal to five percent of the utility franchise fees collected during the previous fiscal year for the purpose of representing local consumer interests in rate cases regulated by this chapter with any unexpended portion of this sum being released to the citys general fund at the end of each fiscal year  duty of franchisees to reimburse the city for costs incurred by the city in investigating negotiating and proving franchises amendments thereto and proposed transfers of franchises  notice and application for franchise authority a any entity which proposes to utilize or continue utilizing city streets alleys easements rightsofway and other public ways or places construction use operation or placement of facilities pipes wires poles or other objects and apparatus of a fixed or permanent nature and any entity which proposes to transfer or sell its franchise plant or system to or merge with another or to transfer lease or permit the use of any rights under a franchise to another herein referred to as transfer or sale of a franchise shall be required to give notice in writing to the city administrator of the city of caon city of its intention and request to seek an initial award of a franchise or the renewal of an existing franchise or the transfer or sale of a franchise said notice shall herein be referred to as an application for franchise authority and the entity giving the notice shall be referred to as the applicant b the application for franchise authority shall set forth the applicants request and the date by which the applicant desires the franchise or the transfer or sale of a franchise to become effective and shall be delivered to the city administrator not less than four months prior to the date the applicant desires the franchise or renewal of franchise or the transfer or sale of a franchise to become effective   duty to reimbursesecurity bond a there is hereby imposed upon an applicant the duty to reimburse and each applicant shall reimburse the city for all costs and expenses incurred by the city in negotiating and approving an initial grant or any renewal of a franchise in investigating the reasonableness of any transfer or sale of a franchise and in the process of approving or disapproving a franchise or a transfer or sale of a franchise including but not limited to city staff time and expenses expert and consulting fees and studies legal fees public hearings and elections if any the citys costs b each applicant shall at the time of filing an application for franchise authority post with the city a cash bond irrevocable letter of credit or other form of security acceptable to the director of finance as security for the payment of citys costs the security bond c the amount of the security bond shall be determined by the director of finance based upon nature and purpose of the request made in the application for franchise authority and an estimate of citys costs the security bond shall not be less than twentyfive thousand and no100 dollars if an election is not required and not less than thirtyfive thousand and no100 dollars if an election is required the city council may waive the requirements of a security bond in whole or in part in its sole discretion failure to post the required security bond may result in a denial of the request made in the application for franchise authority   citys accounting for expenses during franchise negotiations and during the investigation and approval or disapproval process for a franchise or authority to sell or transfer a franchise the city shall maintain an account of all expenses incurred including but not limited to staff time and expenses consulting fees legal fees and administrative and other expenses   citys billing statements the city shall mail to the applicant periodic billing statements for all citys costs said statements shall be billed to the address designated by the applicant in its application for franchise authority said billing statements may be mailed to the applicant at thirtyday intervals and will itemize citys costs to date of billing failure of the city to mail to applicant a billing statement at any thirtyday interval shall not be deemed a waiver by the city of its right to reimbursement of all or any portion of the citys costs   applicants payments applicant shall pay all of citys costs within thirty days of the date the city mails the billing statement failure to pay the citys costs set forth in any billing statement within thirty days of mailing shall constitute a denial of applicants request made in the application for franchise authority and forfeiture of that amount of applicants security bond equal to the citys costs set forth in the billing statement applicant shall remain responsible for and shall reimburse all citys costs that exceed the amount of the security bond   disputesprocedure for resolution a if the applicant disputes the reasonableness of citys costs it may pay under protest and seek review of the billing statement by filing a protest with the city council within thirty days of the mailing of the billing statement if such a protest is filed the city administrator or his designee and the applicant shall appear before the director of finance to hear the matter at a date specified the applicant shall be notified of the hearing date by certified mail at the hearing the applicant may present evidence regarding the reasonableness of the charges the applicant shall bear the burden of proof at the hearing the city administrator or his designee may respond to any allegations of unreasonableness b the hearing shall be held for the sole purpose of determining the reasonableness of citys costs the director of finance is not authorized to consider any evidence challenging the citys decision to incur the costs charged c at the hearing evidence may be received in the form of documents exhibits and witness testimony the director of finance shall have all powers necessary to ensure the fair and efficient conduct of the hearing but shall not be bound by the colorado rules of evidence the hearing shall be open to the public d the director of finance may recommend approval of the charges or make alterations based upon the evidence presented the city council at its next regularly scheduled meeting after the director of finances recommendation shall either approve reject or modify the recommendation any action of the city council is final payment by the applicant or reimbursement by the city as the case may be based upon the city councils decision must be made within seven days of the city councils decision   refund of unused portion of security bond within thirty 30 days after full payment by the applicant of all of the citys costs the city shall return the remaining portion if any of applicants security bond   surcharge prohibited neither the applicants nor the citys costs shall be surcharged against or otherwise charged solely to the city or residents of the city   challenges as to validity legality or constitutionalityexpert witness and attorney fees any applicant or entity challenging the validity legality or constitutionality of this ordinance if unsuccessful shall reimburse the city for all costs incurred in such litigation including reasonable expert witness and attorney fees   severability if any section portion or provision of this chapter is held to be invalid for any reason the remaining sections portions and provisions will be severable and enforceable  title 14 reserved title 15 buildings and construction  codealert this details  basic formula except as otherwise provided in this chapter building permit fees for construction of buildings within the city shall be calculated on a casebycase basis using the following formula permit fee   gross area x square foot construction cost x permit fee multiplier  this topic has been modified view the section for details  alternative method for calculating permit fees a as an alternative to using the basic formula set forth in an applicant for a building permit may elect to have the building permit fee calculated using the permit value for the building structure or other improvement to be constructed altered or repaired as reasonably estimated in good faith by the applicant at the time of application b if this alternative method of calculating the permit fee is elected by the applicant such estimated permit value shall be multiplied times the permit fee multiplier to determine the amount of the permit fee c in order to document the estimate of permit value the applicant at the time of application shall deliver to the building official a true and correct copy of a fullyexecuted construction contract or contracts as the case may be covering all work to be covered by the permit d should any such contract be amended or otherwise modified following the issuance of the building permit with a resulting change in the contract price the applicant shall notify the building official in writing of such amendment or modification within ten 10 days following such amendment or modification and the permit fee shall be recalculated by multiplying the permit value indicated by the changed contract price times the permit fee multiplier used in the original calculation of the permit fee e unless otherwise agreed in writing any increase or decrease in the permit fee shall be paid or refunded as the case may be within thirty 30 days following the recalculation of the permit fee should subsequent amendments or modifications be made that increase or decrease the contract price the same process will be followed with respect to each such amendment or modification until the project has been completed the building official shall require a final copy of each contract as modified andor amended  copies of all change orders  and other evidences of actual cost prior to issuing a certificate of occupancy final building permit value shall be set by the building official using the materials provided by the applicant as a guide no certificate of occupancy shall be issued in the absence of full payment of the applicable permit fee including any increases due to recalculation of the permit fee f permit valuations for purposes of the election that may be made pursuant to of this section shall include the total value of all work including labor and materials for which the permit is to be issued and shall include profit design and construction activity as well as all equipment and systems to be covered by the permit all estimated permit valuations shall be verified by copies of one or more fullyexecuted construction contracts andor other similar documentation deemed appropriate by the building official all copies of such materials shall be retained by the building official in accordance with the citys written records retention policy g if the applicant fails to cooperate with the building official by failing to provide true and correct copies of
