following the completion of the development no changes may be made in the approved final development plat except upon application to the appropriate agency under the procedure provided below 1 any minor extension alteration or modification of existing buildings or structures may be authorized by the planning commission if they are consistent with the purposes and intent of the final plat or plan no changes authorized by this section may increase the dimensions of any building or structure by more than ten percent 10% 2 a building or structure that is totally or substantially destroyed may be reconstructed only in compliance with the final development plat or plan unless an amendment to the final development plan is approved under subsection d3 of this section 3 all other changes in the final development plan or plat must be made by the city council under the procedures authorized by this title for the amendment of the zoning map no changes may be made in the final development plan or plat unless they are required for the continued successful functioning of the planned unit development or unless they are required by changes in conditions that have occurred since the final plat was approved or by changes in the development policy of the community e no changes in the final development plan or plat which are approved under this section are to be considered as a waiver of the covenants limiting the use of land buildings structures and improvements within the area of the planned unit development and all rights to enforce these covenants against any changes permitted in this section are expressly reserved  planned development zone district and planned development district plan  purpose the intent of this chapter is to allow greater flexibility in zoning and to accommodate innovative approaches to development that are consistent with the objectives of the citys comprehensive plan and encourage creative and efficient designs of land uses preservation of significant natural features of the city retention of historic structures and sites retentions of open space compatibility with overall community objectives promote efficient public services and infrastructure and consideration of environmental concerns   definitions definitions applicable to this chapter are set forth in c   general requirements a the zoning regulations and development and design parameters for all uses within a planned development district pdd shall be set forth in a planned development district plan pdd plan which shall be specific to each pdd the pdd plan shall establish the provisions for development which may include without limitation the type of land use and the configuration and intensity of development and the provision of services amenities and infrastructure design that will serve all development within the pdd b there shall be no minimum area required for any pdd provided that no district shall be rezoned as pdd unless 1 the area subject to the pdd is a minimum of ten 10 acres  or 2 the area subject to the pdd proposed to be developed as a single development is comprised of multiple lots with more than one zoning district and such lots are cumulatively a minimum of four 4 acres c design and construction of pdds shall include adequate safe and convenient arrangements for pedestrian circulation roadways driveways offstreet parking and loading space all developments shall provide for pedestrian access from adjacent developments open space areas and trails developments to border streets or open spaces and trails if any d the city may require parks school sites or sites for other public purposes to be provided by the applicant the dedication of parks shall not constitute a purchase or gift of a public park under the citys charter e the general location of all major arterials and collectors shall be shown on the pdd plan f connection to public water and sewer facilities shall be required for uses in all pdds g all utilities shall be placed underground unless specifically identified engineering difficulties prevent such action h setbacks and lot sizes required in the individual zoning categories may be modified or varied such modification shall be in accordance with standards and procedures established in the pdd plan for the proposed development i the total parking requirements of the pdd may exceed the sum of the parking that would be required for each separate use pursuant to the except that the total parking requirements may be reduced if the applicant demonstrates to the city by using standard parking reduction rations that the total number of spaces is not needed within the pdd   application requirements a an application for a pdd shall include a pdd application and pdd plan approval the city may require additional information or details related to the required application material during the review process if it is deemed necessary to complete a thorough review of the applicants proposal in the case of a pdd zone comprising one hundred 100 acres or less the zoning administrator is authorized to waive or limit the information to only that which is deemed necessary due to the small size and other special features of the pdd  provided that the information submitted shall be sufficient to allow for an adequate review of the proposed development b an application for a pdd shall include the following information 1 an application pdd plan and application fee as adopted by the city council 2 a legal description and legal survey drawing of the total site proposed for development including any recorded easements including the addresses of the applicants all owners of property in the proposed pdd zone all owners of severed mineral rights or oil and gas rights and any lienholders 3 evidence of the present ownership or agents thereof of all lands included within the pdd zone in the form of a current commitment for title insurance or title insurance policy or an abstract opinion by an attorney at law 4 authorization of all participating property owners to the application 5 proposed development guide the applicant shall submit a written development guide including graphic illustrations if appropriate that shall include where applicable the following information a a description of the character of the proposed development the goals and objectives of the project an explanation of the rationale behind the assumptions and choices made by the applicant and an explanation of the manner in which all property in the pdd has been planned to conform to the citys comprehensive plan and other growth policies adopted from time to time by the city council  b a regulatory framework of land use regulations standards and guidelines proposed by the developer that define the future use of the entire property and how it will be developed  c a land use chart identifying the following for the pdd and for each planning area within the pdd i acreage for each planning area  ii maximum number of units and the residential unit density gross  iii maximum gross floor areas for all uses other than residential uses  iv building coverage ratios and floor to area ratios for nonresidential uses  v minimum open space in acres and as a percent of the pdd  vi dedicated public open space  vii acreage and percentage of dedicated road coverage for arterials and collectors  viii height limits for each land use type  ix specific uses by right accessory uses conditional uses and special review uses  x setbacks setbacks from major state highways county roads proposed arterials and parking setback details  and xi when a pdd contains more than one planning area all numbers are to be totaled and where appropriate total percent of site area detailed underneath the quantitative totals a condensed form of this chart shall be placed on the pdd plan sheet and must be referenced back to the development guide d planning area map that corresponds to the development guide and land use chart   application review procedure a step 1  general preapplication conference 1 prior to submittal of the pdd application and pdd plan the applicant shall confer with the city planner and city engineer and other agencies as deemed necessary by the city in connection with the preparation of a pdd application any materials prepared by the applicant to be used in discussions during the preapplication conference shall be submitted to the city ten 10 days in advance of the date when the meeting is to take place 2 during the preapplication conference with the applicant city staff shall discuss matters relative to the rezoning and proposed development plan following the preapplication conference the city planner shall furnish the applicant with written comments regarding the conference to inform the applicant about possible development issues and review procedures city staff shall review the application for the purpose of ensuring that all required information has been submitted by the applicant once it is determined that all required information has been submitted the zoning administrator shall issue a letter of completeness to the application b step 2  planning commission review 1 the pdd application shall be submitted to the city for staff review and referral at least fortyfive 45 days in advance of the hearing date before the planning commission the city planner will forward any written comments to the applicant ten 10 days prior to the hearing date 2 the planning commission shall hold a public hearing proceeded by public notice 3 the planning commission after studying the application shall recommend that the city council approve approve with conditions or deny the pdd application c step 3  city council review 1 following the recommendation by the planning commission the city council shall hold a public hearing the hearing shall be preceded by public notice the planning commissions findings and recommendations shall be presented to the city council during the hearing 2 following the public hearing the city council by ordinance may approve approve with conditions or by resolution deny the pdd application 3 if city council approves the pdd application the official zone district map shall be deemed amended to reflect the pdd zone   application approval criteria in reviewing the pdd application and before it grants or recommends approval the planning commission and city council shall find that the proposed pdd application and pdd plan meet the following criteria a the application is complete  b the proposed pdd and pdd plan conform with the citys comprehensive plan and growth policies and the development plan promotes the economic development objectives of the city  c the proposed development will adequately promote or enhance the character of existing land uses in the area and the community as a whole  d open space and amenities will be provided to adequately serve the needs of new residents generated by the proposed development so that the impacts of the development on existing community facilities and amenities will not be materially adverse  e the proposed development will not result in adverse fiscal impact on the city or other service providers  f the city and related service providers are capable of serving the proposed development  the city and other service providers will continue to be capable of providing service over time buildout of the development  the impact of the proposed development on existing utility infrastructure and facilities will not be materially adverse  and there are adequate plans for accommodating police fire protection and emergency medical services in the development  g the proposed development plan will include adequate safe and reliable infrastructure including streets and circulation water sewer stormwater and other utilities and related facilities to serve the development and such infrastructure whether public or private in nature will be constructed to acceptable standards  there are suitable plans to ensure that such infrastructure can and will be expanded adequately over time to accommodate a phased buildout if applicable  and there will be suitable mechanisms in place to ensure that privatelyowned utility infrastructure can be maintained indefinitely by its owners  h the property on which the development is proposed is suitable for the type of development proposed  and i the pdd plan represents a practicable and feasible approach to development that public interest has been achieved and the plan promotes the health safety and general welfare of the citizens of caon city   amendments a the pdd plan as finally approved shall be binding and shall not be changed during the construction of the development except upon application to the zoning administrator under the following procedures 1 minor changes to a pdd plan may be authorized by the zoning administrator for the following modifications a adjustment to the planning area boundary lines within the pdd boundary  b allowing land uses not specifically allowed in the pdd if it is determined that the proposed characteristics and impacts of the uses are consistent with other uses that are allowed in the pdd  c the transfer of residential density or commercial or industrial square footage from one planning area to another provided that there is no increase in the total number of dwelling units or commercial square footage authorized in the approved pdd and provided that the planned infrastructure can reasonably accommodate said change  d a change in the approved phasing plan  provided however that all infrastructure improvements and facilities necessary to serve the desired development phase will be provided or that suitable temporary improvements can be constructed to meet the needs of the development phase until such time as permanent improvements and facilities consistent with the approved pdd plan will be provided  e a reduction of less than fifteen percent 15% of the original areas reserved for open space and recreation areas  f an increase or decrease in any minimum or maximum dimensional standard in the approved pdd plan eg setback height lot width lot coverage by no more than twentyfive percent 25%  or g allow for technical adjustments in detailed construction plans that are necessary to address constraints or unanticipated circumstances that arise following the pdd plan approval but prior to or during final design and actual construction of the project 2 all other changes in use any rearrangement of lots or changes in the provision of open space shall be considered as a new pdd plan   inactive developments any parcel or tract of land which has been granted pdd zoning or any portion of land within a development which has been granted pdd zoning for a period in excess of three 3 years prior to the effective date of the ordinance granting pdd zoning and for which no preliminary or final plat has been approved by the city or no public improvements have been constructed or secured for such parcel or tract or portion thereof shall be required to submit and receive city council approval of a pdd plan amendment which shall comply with all requirements of this chapter in effect at the time of amendment prior to the submission of a preliminary plat final plat or site plan  riverfront zone districts general provisions  purpose and intent the primary purpose and intent for use of the riverfront zone districts within the city of caon city is to a provide for a strong urban presence along the north side of the arkansas river within the core of caon city  b maximize the development potential of key sections of the citys riverfront  c impart strategic guidance to support exceptional development practices  d allow for flexibility and creativity in mixeduse development  e accommodate a variety of higher intensity residential building types for riverfront living  f provide for public access to an expanded riverwalk along the riverfront in a manner that complements development  and g provide for a transition from the rfmu district and other nonresidential uses to residential andor agricultural uses   applicability a general location within city limits the riverfront zone districts are intended to be utilized generally as follows 1 riverfront mixeduse rfmu between 1st and 11th streets on the north side of the arkansas river and south of the railroad tracks 2 riverfront residential rfr between 1st and 11th streets on the south side of the arkansas river within five hundred 500 feet of the edge of floodway and excluding existing inuse commercial or industrial property near 9th street b framework plan the framework plan figures 1 and 2 provides guidance on general areas for application of the riverfront zone districts rfmu and rfr the framework plan also identifies key frontages for parcels and where subareas depending on context are accommodated c applicability of other provisions of title 17 unless otherwise expressly stated in this chapter for matters not addressed in this applicable provisions of title 17 shall apply in the event of a conflict between this chapter and other provisions of title 17 the provisions of this chapter shall control figure 1 riverfront mixed use rfmu framework plan figure 2 riverfront residential rfr framework plan   definitions the definitions listed in this section shall apply only to zone districts governed by this chapter the words and terms used in this chapter shall have the meanings set forth below if a definition is not listed below then the definition listed in this govern if there is a conflict between the definitions in the definitions in this chapter then the definitions in this chapter shall govern if a term is not found in this the term shall have its common meaning amenity zone means the part of a public rightofway that includes incidental public amenities such as benches trash receptacles and pedestrian light fixtures conferencemeeting facilities means a type of use that has fundamental equipment facilities and services necessary to hold and run conferences or meetings court means an open space enclosed by residential buildings which front the open space for access day spa means a business that provides a variety of services for the purpose of improving health and beauty services such as hair facial massage dwelling multifamily means a building used by three 3 or more attached dwelling units including apartments and condominiums primarily but not exclusively with common entries from the street and not including hotels motels resorts or group accommodations dwelling rowhome means a residential building containing three 3 or more attached dwelling units each on its own lot and with direct access to the outside but not including hotels motels resorts or group accommodations fitness center means a business that is equipped to provide indoor exercise and health related functions and may include incidental retail sales and food and beverage service floorplate means the horizontal structure at the base of a building andor between stories of a building the floorplate includes joists and other structural components subflooring and finish flooring material floorplate area is the square feet of the length multiplied by the width of a floorplate kennel limited means a commercial facility licensed by the state of colorado department of agriculture to house dogs cats or other small household pets indoor only for boarding or training purposes this use shall not include the selling transferring adopting or breeding of dogs key frontage means the frontage of a parcel identified of the framework plan to regulate setbacks and design standards lane means a public or private rightofway designed to accommodate pedestrians bicycles and vehicles equally with a narrow design and slow speed of travel for vehicles lot means a parcel of land shown as a lot on a recorded plat or a parcel of land described by metes and bounds on a recorded deed parapet means the part of a wall that extends above the roof personal services limited means an activity primarily engaged in providing services generally involving the care of the person including activities like day spas or travel agencies this use does not include laundry dry cleaning services employment or answering services primary frontage means the key frontage as identified in the framework plan the street frontage if a key frontage is not identified or the primary entrance faade of a business that may not have street frontage structure accessory means a structure located on the same lot as the principal structure accessory structures are incidental and subordinate to the principal structure accessory structures include items such as garages sheds barns private greenhouses decks and fences but do not include shipping containers or similar storage units structured parking garage means a building or structure consisting of one or more levels or floors used for the parking or storage of vehicles a parking structure maybe below grade or either partially or totally above grade with those levels or floors being either open or enclosed structure historic means a structure that is designated at the state or national level as an individual structure or a contributing structure to a designated district for historic cultural or architectural reasons surface parking lot means a site or a portion of a site devoted to the offstreet parking of vehicles including parking spaces aisles access drives and landscaped areas and areas providing vehicular access to a public street trade or repair shop limited means a shop where a form of occupation skilled manual or limited mechanical work manual craft or artisan skills is conducted such as by a jeweler woodworker metalworking glass blower and leather craftsman so long as the occupation or activity does not emit loud noises or noxious fumes shops may not employ more than fifteen 15 persons use accessory means a use which is normally incidental to subordinate to and devoted exclusively to the primary use of the property utility services public or essential government limited means the erection construction alteration or maintenance by public utilities or municipal government of local provision gas electrical steam cable internet or water services no office repair storage substation or production facilities are allowed  districts and regulations signs a purpose the purpose of this section is to promote public health safety and welfare by 1 providing sign regulations in the riverfront area that support creation of a unique sense of place and character within the city  2 regulating the number location size type illumination and other physical characteristics of signs within the riverfront area to promote the public health safety and welfare of the city  and 3 supporting the citys strategic prioritizes of economic development and improving the built environment while providing for effective means of communication consistent with constitutional guarantees it is not the purpose or intent of this section to regulate the message displayed on any sign the content of the message or speech displayed on the sign shall not be reviewed or considered in determining whether to approve or deny a sign b applicability this subsection shall only apply to the zone districts governed by except as expressly stated in this section the regulations in shall not apply to the zone districts governed by this chapter c definitions the definitions listed in this subsection shall apply only to this shall have the meanings set forth below lf a definition is not listed below then the definition listed in the other sections of shall govern lf the definition in not listed in this then the definitions in title 17 shall govern if there is any conflict between a definition in this subsection and any other part of title 17 than the definitions in this subsection shall apply if the term is not found in this the term shall have its common meaning alteration means any change modification or addition to the structure of any sign with the exception of a nonmaterial alteration such as simple maintenance and refurbishing of an existing message area means the greatest number of square feet of sign exposed to public view business means a commercial establishment with a storefront flag means any fabric banner or bunting containing distinctive colors patterns or symbols and is attached to a pole and which is intended to be permanently affixed to the ground or attached to a building but does not include a feather flag sign flagging streamers and pennants means a continuous length of cord or other similar material to which long narrow flags or pennants are attached for the purpose of attracting attention to a business or location height means the distance from grade to the top of the sign structure as erected in a vertical line level ground means the lowest level of a building in which the majority of the height of that level is exposed above the adjacent street or riverwalk ground elevation level upper means any other level of a building above the ground level multitenant building means a building that provides leased space or condominium ownership to more than one tenant or owner particularly a building that includes multiple ground level storefronts mural means a painted wall sign that does not contain a business logo business name or commercial message sign means any display device figure painting drawing message placard poster billboard or any other contrivance designed intended or used to promote the interest of any person or to give information and being in public view sign animated means any sign or part of a sign which changes physical position by any movement rotation or change in lighting sign awning means any permanent sign printed and attached to the vertical valance or sloped area of an awning that is attached to a building sign directional means a permanent freestanding sign reasonably necessary for the safe circulation of pedestrian or vehicular traffic within a given area and excluding those erected by the us or state of colorado department of transportation sign electronic message means an automated sign which may be programmed by computer using moving illuminated words or graphics sign feather flag means a temporary freestanding sign typically constructed of a single plastic or metal shaft driven in the ground with an attached pennant that is vertically elongated and attached to the shaft sign flashing means any directly or indirectly illuminated sign either stationary or animated which exhibits changing natural or artificial light or color by any means sign flexible banner means a temporary sign of a flexible material that is mounted to a building fence or to the ground via more than one structured pole sign freestanding means a sign that is mounted to the ground and not to any other structure sign inflatable means any temporary freestanding inflatable shape or figure designed or used to attract attention to an event or location sign monument means a permanent freestanding sign that has more than seventyfive 75% of its bottom edge affixed to andor touching the ground sign nonconforming means any sign which does not conform to the requirements of this section but on the effective date of this section was lawfully maintained and had been lawfully erected in accordance with prior applicable sign regulation sign official means a sign required by law or constructed placed or maintained by the state the federal government or the city the inclusion of government in defining such signs does not intend to subject the government to regulation but instead helps describe the type of sign that falls within the immunities of the government from regulation sign offpremise means a sign displaying advertising copy that pertains to a business person organization activity event place service or product not principally located or primarily manufactured or sold on the lot on which the sign is located also referred to as a billboard sign permanent means a sign that is designed to be used on a permanent basis permanent signs include wall signs freestanding signs window signs awning signs directional signs and projecting signs sign portable means a sign that is constructed in a manner that it can be moved or relocated without involving any structural or support changes sign projecting means a sign or marquee affixed to and projecting from any building or structure sign rigid banner means a temporary sign of a rigid material that is mounted to the ground via structured poles sign roof means any sign which is erected or constructed wholly upon andor over the roof of any building and supported on the roof of the structure freestanding signs which pass overhang roof or canopy shall be considered roof signs sign sandwich board means an aframetype sign that is portable and is hinged or unhinged or is vertical and located on skids or runners and is readily movable a sandwich board sign does not include a sign attached to or affixed on an individual sign temporary means a sign that is designed to be used only temporarily and is not intended to be permanently attached to a building wall or sign structure or permanently installed in the ground temporary signs expressly include yard signs feather flag signs inflatable signs flexible banner signs and rigid banner signs sign wall means a permanent sign which is painted on or fastened to the wall or parapet of a building or structure in such a manner that the wall becomes the supporting structure or forms the background surface of the sign a mural shall not be considered a wall sign sign window means a permanent sign applied or attached to the exterior or interior of storefront glazing with vinyl graphics and meant to be legible from the exterior sign yard means a temporary sign constructed of paper vinyl plastic wood metal or other comparable material that is mounted on a state or frame structure that includes one or more stakes storefront means the ground level primary frontage of a business that is readily accessible and visible to the general public storefront glazing means any glass area encompassed by a frame within the storefront of a business structure means that which is erected or constructed with a fixed location from the ground above grade any piece of work artificially built up or composed of parts joined together in some definite manner excluding poles cables or other transmission or distribution facilities of public utilities wall means for purposes of this chapter an exterior surface of a building which has a slope of greater than sixty 60 degrees from the horizontal plane d rules of measurement the area calculation of sign area  each area of a sign that can be enclosed by a line or an imaginary line shall be considered one sign each side of a twosided sign shall be used to calculate the maximum allowed sign area   the area of measurement of a sign contained within a cabinet or frame shall include the total area of the cabinet or frame   the area of measurement of a sign that displays individual letters on a wall awning or canopy or as pan channel letters shall be determined by encompassing all the letters in a geometric form of no more than eight 8 rectilinear lines at right angles to each other   the total surface area of multiple unit signs includes the vertical and horizontal spacing between signs   the sign area of each sign face of monument directional projecting and yard signs that have two faces shall be measured to calculate the maximum allowed sign area  3 calculation of total number of signs the following should be used to determine the number of permanent all districts 1 maintenance a every sign shall be maintained in good condition at all times a sign in good condition shall meet the following criteria i signs shall be rust free ii plastic acrylic and other similar materials shall not be broken cracked torn or faded iii banners awnings flags and feather flags shall not be torn faded or in disrepair iv all lighting where permitted must be functional and no exposed light sources are permitted unless approved with the permit b the city shall have the authority to inspect signs to ensure adequate maintenance and compliance with this section c if upon inspection staff determines a sign to be in violation of this section or a safety hazard the staff may order the sign to be maintained or removed by the property owner 2 nonconforming signs a continuance subject to the termination hereinafter provided any nonconforming sign may be continued in operation and be maintained after the effective date of the ordinance codified in this section or any amendment thereto  provided however that no such sign shall be modified in any manner that increases the nonconformity of such sign b termination of a nonconforming sign shall take place upon i structural change to any nonconforming sign ii structural alteration to prolong the life of the sign except to meet safety requirements iii alteration or expansion in any manner which increases the degree of nonconformity iv damage or destruction if the estimated cost of reconstruction exceeds fifty percent 50% of the value of the sign structure prior to being damaged v any violation of this section shall terminate immediately the right to maintain such sign 3 official signs danger signs emergency signs and legal notices may be placed by responsible persons upon approval of the city administrator 4 no sign shall be erected constructed maintained or altered within the city in violation of the caon city including but not limited to this proper vision clearance shall be provided at all times 6 no sign of any type shall be erected or placed so as to obstruct any necessary egress in case of fire 7 all exterior signs shall be designed and constructed to resist the wind effects shall abut a street other than alley for a width of at least forty 40 feet   agriculture agriculture shall be a permitted use in an rl zone district provided a no offensive odors or excessive dust be created  and b no agricultural products be sold on the property which are not produced on said property   animal boarding animal boarding may be permitted as a conditional use in the rl r1 c and i zone districts upon the issuance of a conditional use permit according to the policies and procedures set forth in conditional uses and subject to the following conditions a every animal boarding facility shall at all times be licensed as a pet animal care facility with the colorado department of agriculture  b such facilities shall be maintained with regular and frequent cleaning to minimize the possibility of unhealthy or unsafe conditions all manure bedding spillage and leftovers from feedings shall be removed and disposed of to prevent fly and rodent propagation or odor at least weekly  c any structure used for the boarding of animals shall be located at least twenty 20 feet from any side or rear property line  d the boarding of animals shall to the extent applicable comply with the terms conditions and limitations that apply to the keeping of livestock as set forth in this title   backyard chickens backyard chickens may be permitted in the r1 and r2 zone districts as an accessory use and on properties used for residential purposes in the c and i zone districts upon the issuance of a conditional use permit according to the policies and procedures set forth in conditional uses and subject to the following conditions a no more than eight 8 chicken hens shall be allowed on any property unless the property meets the minimum area requirement for livestock according to this title  b the ownership and keeping of roosters over six 6 months old is prohibited  c chicken hens must be provided with a covered enclosure that is predatorresistant properly ventilated and easily accessed for cleaning and maintenance and that provides not less than four 4 square feet per chicken  d during daylight hours chicken hens must be provided access to an outside enclosure that is adequately fenced to prevent the escape of the chickens and to provide protection from predators the outside enclosure must provide a minimum of ten 10 square feet of permeable space per chicken and may be either attached to the covered enclosure or portable a fully fenced backyard may be deemed to meet this requirement  e the chickens must be placed in the covered enclosure between the hours of dusk and dawn to provide protection from predators  f setbacks 1 any enclosure for backyard chickens must be located in the backyard of the property measured from the rear wall of the residential dwelling the zoning administrator may allow exceptions to this requirement in cases of lots having unusual site dimensions terrain limitations or other unique characteristics  2 no covered enclosure may be located less than eight 8 feet from any abutting property line or less than thirty 30 feet from any residential dwelling on any adjoining lot  g the covered enclosure must be cleaned so that odors due to excessive dirt waste excrement or old feed do not become a nuisance safety hazard or health problem to adjoining property or uses  h the onsite slaughtering of backyard chickens is prohibited   bed and breakfast a bed and breakfast may be permitted as a conditional use upon the issuance of a conditional use permit according to the policies and procedures set forth in conditional uses and subject to the following conditions a offstreet parking shall be provided at the rate of one space for the dwelling owner andor operator and one space for each lodging room  b offstreet parking areas shall be designed to provide safe ingress and egress  c in residential zone districts landscaping and screening shall be provided to maintain the residential character of the building and preserve the right of neighboring residents to enjoy a peaceful occupancy of their homes  d any outdoor lighting shall be shielded to minimize light shining onto adjacent properties  e all signage must comply with applicable provisions of signs of this title  f the property used for a bed and breakfast facility shall also serve as the primary residence of the owner or manager  g bed and breakfast facilities in residential districts may have no more than two 2 onduty employees at any given time who do not reside in the bed and breakfast residence   beekeeping domestic noncommercial beekeeping may be permitted as an accessory use in the rl r1 and r2 zone districts only subject to the following conditions a hives all bee colonies shall be kept in hives with removable combs which shall be kept in sound and usable condition  b setbacks all hives shall be located in a side or rear yard only and at least five 5 feet from any adjoining property with the back of the hive facing the nearest adjoining property  c colony densities 1 it is unlawful to keep more than the following number of colonies on any tract within the city based upon the size or configuration of the tract on which the apiary is situated a onequarter 14 acre or less tract sizetwo 2 colonies  b more than onequarter 14 acre but less than onehalf 12 acre tract sizefour 4 colonies  c more than onehalf 12 acre but less than one 1 acre tract sizesix 6 colonies  d one 1 acre or larger tract sizeeight 8 colonies  and e regardless of tract size where all hives are situated at least two hundred 200 feet in any direction from all property lines of the tract on which the apiary is situated there shall be no limit to the number of colonies  2 for each two 2 colonies authorized under colony densities there may be maintained upon the same tract one nucleus colony in a hive structure not exceeding one standard nine and fiveeighths inch 9 depth ten 10 frame hive body with no supers attached as required from time to time for management of swarms each such nucleus colony shall be disposed of or combined with an authorized colony within thirty 30 days after the date it is acquired  d fencing of flyways in each instance in which any colony is situated within twentyfive 25 feet of a property line of a developed public or private tract as measured from the nearest point on the hive to the property line the beekeeper shall establish and maintain a flyway barrier at least six feet 6 in height consisting of a hedge solid wall or fence parallel to the property line and extending ten feet 10 beyond the colony in each direction so that all bees are forced to fly at an elevation of at least six feet 6 above ground level over the property lines in the vicinity of the apiary  e water each property owner or beekeeper shall ensure that a convenient source of water is available at all times to the bees so that the bees will not congregate at swimming pools water spigots pet water bowls birdbaths or other water sources where they may cause human bird or domestic pet contact the water shall be maintained so as not to become stagnant  f maintenance each property owner or beekeeper shall ensure that no bee comb or other materials that might encourage robbing are left upon the grounds of the apiary site upon their removal from the hive all such materials shall promptly be disposed of in a sealed container or placed within a building or other bee proof enclosure  g queens in any instance in which a colony exhibits unusually aggressive characteristics by stinging or attempting to sting without due provocation or exhibits an unusual disposition towards swarming it shall be the duty of the beekeeper to requeen the colony queens shall be selected from stock bred for gentleness and nonswarming characteristics  h prohibited the keeping by any person of bee colonies in the city not in strict compliance with this section is prohibited any bee colony not residing in a hive structure intended for beekeeping or any swarm of bees or any colony residing in a standard or homemade hive which by virtue of its condition has obviously been abandoned by the beekeeper is unlawful and may be summarily destroyed or removed from the city by the officer or animal control officer   boarding or rooming house a boarding or rooming house may be permitted as a conditional use property lines abutting a public rightofway are based upon the assumption that said rightofway meets the standards set forth in the comprehensive plan if the row does not meet the width standard called for the building setback requirement shall be increased by the distance necessary to accommodate the required rightofway said distance shall be found by measuring from the center line of the rightofway half the width required by the comprehensive plan to find the point from which the setback shall be measured   stormwater and drainage easements when a building subject to the adopted building code is located on property traversed by a drainage way including but not limited to a watercourse swale channel irrigation ditch or stream the owner prior to obtaining a certificate of occupancy shall execute an easement agreement for stormwater andor drainage purposes for the benefit of the city the easement shall conform substantially to the banks of the drainage way with such width as will be necessary to fulfill the purposes of the easement as determined by the city and the agreement shall grant the city the right to access adjacent property to perform any necessary acts related to the easement if necessary the city may require a survey of the easement and the costs of such survey shall be paid by the applicant wherever possible it is desirable that the drainage be maintained by an open channel with stabilized banks and adequate width for the one percent annual chance historic flow   exotic animals a no person shall own keep traffic in or sell for any reason any rental spaces for visitors  parking spaces within a mobile home park shall meet the standards as set forth in dimensional standards of this title the surface of interior streets and parking spaces shall comply with the surfacing requirements as set forth in a of this title 5 recreational vehicle and equipment storage recreational vehicle and equipment storage space shall be provided at the rate of one hundred 100 square feet per mobile home rental space and in such a manner as to not distract from the orderly appearance of the residential atmosphere 6 sidewalks sidewalks a minimum width of three 3 feet shall be provided adjacent to all interior streets the sidewalk may be so constructed as to provide a curb alongside the street surfacing or may be placed adjacent to a standard curb and gutter sidewalks shall be constructed of concrete four 4 inches minimum thickness over a four 4 inch thick compacted granular material base 7 water system water main improvements in abutting public rightsofway shall be as required during the review process for the mobile home park and shall be installed in compliance with applicable city specifications a master meter generally located in the public rightofway at the property line shall serve the water system inside the mobile home park in situations where a six 6 inch water main is installed to serve fire hydrants located within the park a smaller private water main may be connected to the six 6 inch fire main to provide the domestic water to the mobile home rental spaces a master meter shall be installed where the smaller main is connected to the larger main private meters for the individual services are optional but may be used only after obtaining city council approval 8 sanitary sewer system sanitary sewer service must be connected to a fremont sanitation district public sewer main the interior sewer system to serve each mobile home rental space shall be approved by the fremont sanitation district 9 stormwater management a stormwater management plan shall be prepared by a registered professional engineer to address the stormwater runoff from the mobile home park in most cases an onsite stormwater detention facility will be required an overlot grading plan must be submitted to show that each rental pad will be adequately drained 10 area lighting lighting shall be provided with a minimum of 03 footcandles on all driveways and walks street lights shall be provided as required during the review process 11 addressing each mobile home park shall have a designated street address which shall appear on the sign identifying the park see signs in residential districts within the park each mobile home rental space shall be clearly identified with space numbers placed on the manufactured home such numbers shall be not less than two and onehalf 2 12 inches in height and shall be so marked as to be distinctly and easily read from the abutting street 12 refuse disposal the storage collection and disposal of refuse in a mobile home park shall be so conducted as to control odors rodents insects accidents fire hazard air pollution or other nuisance conditions a durable washable and nonabsorbent metal or plastic containers with tightfitting lids shall be provided at each mobile home rental space or at a central storage area conveniently located not more than two hundred 200 feet from any mobile home rental space refuse containers shall be provided at a rate of at least one thirty 30 gallon four 4 cubic feet container for each mobile home rental space or an equivalent storage capacity in centralized storage facilities any such centralized facility shall be screened from the public view b the number of containers used and the frequency of collection shall be sufficient to prevent overfilled containers refuse shall be routinely collected and removed from the premises not less than once weekly refuse shall be disposed of at a lawful disposal site in accordance with the requirements of the colorado solid waste disposal sites and facilities act c licensing management and operation 1 licensing requirements no person shall operate or maintain within the city any mobile home park without first securing from the city clerk a license for the same according to the provisions set forth in mobile home parks of the municipal management and operation a each mobile home park shall be under the direct management of the owner or lessee or his or her agent or representative such person shall operate the park from an office located on the grounds in which office shall be maintained all registration records and in which there shall be displayed the license for such mobile home park b it shall be the duty of the manager of each mobile home park i to prohibit the placing or storage of unsightly materials or vehicles of any kind on the premises  ii to provide a registration book and keep a complete daily record of the names and addresses of the occupants of each mobile home admitted to the park and the mobile home serial number and shall furnish copies thereof to the chief of police upon demand and the same shall be subject to inspection by any state county city police or officer  iii to take such other measures as may be deemed necessary by the administrator to preserve the health comfort and safety of all persons in the park and of the general public 3 inspection authority  license revocation all proper officers of the city shall have access to each mobile home park at all reasonable times to inspect the same and ascertain whether this chapter is being complied with if any person operating a mobile home park shall fail to maintain the same in a safe and sanitary condition or maintains and operates it contrary to the requirements and regulations set forth in the ordinances of the city or contrary to the requirements and regulations herein set forth it shall be the duty of the city administrator with approval of the city council to revoke such mobile home park license d standards for mobile home installation and placement 1 a mobile home placement and skirting permit shall be obtained prior to or upon delivery of any mobile home mobile home  or as required by the fhava agencies when that type of financing is in place  or as approved by the officer as equal to or better than above all skirting shall have adequate ventilation provided 4 mobile home park owners and managers shall notify the city prior to any mobile home placement within their facility 5 the owner of a mobile home shall request a placement inspection at the county laws codes and regulations       outdoor retail sales a outdoor retail sales is defined at this outdoor retail sales may be sales from nonpermanent structures including motor vehicles trailer retail sales insofar as the same are applicable      22  recreational vehicle rv parks this use is intended to provide commercial rental parking spaces and sites for recreational vehicles rvs including motor homes travel trailers pickup campers and tent trailers  to provide goods and services customarily needed by occupants of the park  and to assure reasonable standards for the development of facilities for the occupancy of recreational vehicles on a temporary basis ranging from short overnight stops to longer destinationtype stays of several days to weeks all recreational vehicle rv parks within the city of caon city shall be governed by the following regulations a design standards for recreational vehicle rv parks 1 minimum park area the minimum size of an rv park shall be three 3 acres 2 rental space size minimum rental space size for those spaces having utility hookups shall be one thousand five hundred 1500 square feet minimum rental space size for those spaces not having hookups shall be nine hundred 900 square feet minimum rental space size shall not include any area required for access roads offstreet parking service buildings recreation areas office and similar rv park needs 3 rental pads a minimum of eighty percent 80% of all spaces shall be equipped with a surfaced area of not less than ten 10 feet by forty 40 feet containing hookups for water sewer and electricity surfacing shall consist of gravel asphalt or concrete where gravel surfacing is used the design of the gravel pad shall be approved by the city engineer to maintain proper drainage and minimize dust where provided each rv unit shall be parked entirely on the surfaced area so that no part thereof obstructs any roadway or walkway within the rv park those spaces not equipped with such a surfaced area intended for occupancy by recreational vehicles not having selfcontained toilet lavatory or bathing facilities shall be equipped with a gravel pad the design of which shall be approved by the city engineer of not less than ten 10 feet by twentyfive 25 feet for rv unit parking and a hookup for water spaces equipped with such a gravel pad shall not exceed twenty percent 20% of the total number of spaces in the rv park 4 setback requirements each rental space shall meet the following setback requirements a fifty 50 feet when abutting a state or federal highway or designated major arterial  b twentyfive 25 feet when abutting a public rightofway other than a above  c fifteen 15 feet when abutting any property line other than a or b above  d there shall be a minimum distance of ten 10 feet provided between rv units parked side by side  e there shall be a minimum distance of ten 10 feet between rv units parked end to end  f there shall be a minimum distance of twenty 20 feet between any rv space and any building 5 streets streets or roadways and parking areas within the rv park shall be designed to provide safe and convenient access to all spaces and to facilities for common use by park occupants and shall be constructed and maintained to allow free movement of emergency and service vehicles at all times and shall be graded to drain and surfaced with gravel asphalt or concrete the design of which shall be approved by the city engineer to maintain proper drainage and minimize dust all interior roadways shall be at least thirtytwo 32 feet in width for twoway traffic and at least eighteen 18 feet in width for oneway traffic a fortyfive 45 foot turning radius shall be required on all curves to allow access by emergency vehicles any bridges within the development shall have a capacity of at least sixteen 16 tons to allow access by emergency vehicles road grades shall not exceed six 6 percent access into the park from a public street shall meet the same design standards as those of the public street for a distance of forty 40 feet from the property line into the development all roadways and walkways within the park shall be adequately lighted at night to provide safe access 6 frontage all spaces shall have a minimum frontage of twenty 20 feet along an interior roadway 7 sanitary facilities every rv park shall be provided with one or more service buildings equipped with flush toilets lavatories showers and laundry facilities meeting minimum state health department standards such facilities shall be conveniently located at a distance of not more than three hundred 300 feet from any rv served such facilities shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition and plumbing fixtures shall be maintained in good working order all such facilities shall be adequately lighted at all times of the day and night and shall be well ventilated portable fire extinguishers of a type approved by the caon city fire protection district shall be kept in the service buildings and at all locations designed by the fire district and shall be maintained in operating condition 8 sanitary disposal stations every rv park shall contain at least one sanitary disposal station for the sole purpose of removing and disposing of wastes from holding tanks in a clean efficient and convenient manner a each sanitary station shall consist of a drainage basin constructed of impervious material containing a disposal hatch and selfclosing cover and related washing facilities b the disposal hatch of sanitary station units shall be connected to the sewage disposal system related facilities required to wash holding tanks and the general area of the sanitary station shall be connected to the rv park water supply system c each sanitary station shall have a sign posted stating dangernot to be used for drinking or domestic purposes d sanitary stations shall be approved by the state department of health 9 utilities all utilities shall be placed underground a water supply an accessible adequate safe and potable supply of water under pressure shall be provided in every rv park the water supply system shall be designed constructed and maintained in compliance with the state health department standards and applicable city standards all plans and specifications shall be submitted with the zoning or rezoning request each rental space equipped with sewer and electrical hookups shall also be equipped with two water outlets to provide connection for the rv and a garden hose all other rental spaces shall be equipped with one water outlet b sanitary sewer a minimum of eighty percent 80% of all rental spaces shall be equipped with a hookup to a public sewage system by way of a branch line and riser pipe at least four 4 inches inside diameter the riser pipe shall be capped with a watertight cap or plug when not in use sanitary sewage systems shall be installed in compliance with the state health department standards and the rules and regulations of the fremont sanitation district or other such governing authority all plumbing in the rv park shall comply with state and local plumbing laws and regulations c electricity a minimum of eighty percent 80% of all rental spaces shall be equipped with an electrical outlet supplying at least 110 volts or 110220 volts installed in accordance with applicable state electrical codes 10 refuse disposal the storage collection and disposal of refuse shall be performed so as to minimize accidents fire hazards air pollution odors insects rodents or other nuisance conditions all refuse shall be stored in durable washable and nonabsorbent metal or plastic containers with tightfitting lids such containers shall be provided at the rate of at least one thirty 30 gallon container secured in a rack or holder for each rental space or an equivalent storage capacity in centralized storage facilities adequate refuse collection and removal shall be the responsibility of the park owner 11 landscaping a landscape plan to be approved by the superintendent of parks and forestry of the city of caon city shall be required for all rv parks landscaping shall be designed to perform the following functions a screen the rv park visually and audibly from adjacent properties as completely as possible  b provide an attractive entrance and street frontage  c provide dust and erosion control  d provide a neat attractive and aesthetically pleasing appearance grass and ornamental landscaping shall be required in all rv parks together with adequate water outlets to maintain all landscaping the rv park shall be screened from adjacent properties by means of fences or walls six 6 feet in height or by means of hedges or other landscaping 12 open space open space for common areas playgrounds and other recreational uses shall be provided at the rate of at least ten percent 10% of the gross area of the rv park and shall be of sufficient size and distribution as to be a functional part of the entire development plan open space shall not include any area designated as a roadway rv rental space storage area swimming pool yard area surrounding the caretakers or managers residence or any area required for setbacks as set forth in a4 of these regulations 13 fire protection fire hydrants shall be installed throughout all rv parks in accordance with the specifications of the caon city fire protection district there shall be one hydrant at the entrance to the development and additional hydrants at a distance not to exceed three hundred 300 feet between hydrants all buildings within the rv park shall be equipped with fire extinguishing equipment in good working order of such type size and number as prescribed by the fire district 14 structural additions temporary structures such as canvas awnings screened enclosures or platforms which are normal camping equipment may be erected but must be removed when the rental space is vacated no other structural additions shall be built onto or become a part of any rv 15 storage sheds no storage sheds shall be allowed within an rv rental space 16 fires fires shall be made only in stoves and other equipment intended for such purposes and placed in safe and convenient locations where they will not constitute fire hazards to vegetation undergrowth trees and rvs no open fires are allowed 17 tents tents shall be permitted and their number shall be limited to one tent per rental space areas for group tent camping may be established with the following provisions a the area set aside for such group use is not a part of any designated open space  b an adequate number of parking spaces is provided  c the area is served by one or more water outlets  and d the area is located no further than three hundred 300 feet from a service building 18 registration of occupants it shall be the responsibility of the owner or manager of the rv park to keep a current record of the names and addresses of the owners andor occupants of each rv space the make model year and license number of each rv and motor vehicle by which it is towed the state territory or country issuing such licenses and the arrival and departure dates of each occupant this record must be made available for inspection to all appropriate agencies whose duties necessitate acquisition 19 swimming pools swimming pools and natural swimming areas shall be operated maintained and used in compliance with recommendations and requirements of the colorado department of healths regulations and standards governing swimming pools and swimming areas b where established a recreational vehicle rv park may be established on any tract of land held in single ownership or unified control provided that the applicant shall show and the planning commission and the city council shall find 1 that the site is in conformance with sound planning principles and the land use plan for that area as set forth in the comprehensive plan  2 that the site has an acceptable relationship to the major thoroughfare plan of the city and is accessible to recreational vehicles without causing disruption to residential areas  and 3 that the proposed recreational 2 persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public officials  3 any person selling or advertising for sale an item or items of personal property which are specifically named or
